items.title: 0n 22/01/24
items.review_text:
0n 22/01/24, I bought a ticket through SE app but the app froze. No notification and no ticket received but payment was still taken from my Barclays account without me realising. Day after, I tried to process through PayPal, same again. PayPal reimbursed me but the other payment still hasn't. Contacted the station, no complaints can be processed from there. Tried calling a few times but was just on hold. Made a complaint online to which they did answer by referring me to the online retail team without telling me how to liaise with them. No obvious link on their app.
Southeastern, this is really poor. Get your customer service sorted and an easy way for clients to complain and be refunded.
Advice is stay away from their app. If things go wrong, you're not likely to gey money back

items.title: Connection times
items.review_text: As usual Southeastern trains show passengers contempt with their annoying timing of services. Having caught the 12.52 from Marden to Paddock Wood My hope was to get on the 13.00 service to Strood But given 2 minutes to get over the footbridge Very little chance. I get halfway down the platform  only to see it pull out If anybody at Southeastern is reading this review. Which I doubt Just for once can you consider needs of passengers and reschedule times to allow passengers changing trains a chance to catch connections In other words passengers before profit

items.title: Huge thank you to Southeastern Rail…
items.review_text: Huge thank you to Southeastern Rail Customer Service for their efforts getting my suitcase back to me within hours and in time for my flight after I left it on the train! Especially to Henry who took my boyfriend’s call and the Orpington station staff.

items.title: Stop doing strike
items.review_text: Stop doing strike! For more money you need to do something else.  The internet is full of free courses like IT or construction. For more money you need to do more than standing on the platform and chat with people.  Please stop doing strike. I already pay £55 a day. Please stop!

items.title: Strike
items.review_text:
What has the strike don for u gus

🤬Nothing so stop its noy worth it go find another job if u dont get paid enough

,

items.title: Couldn't even run a bath
items.review_text:
Trains smell like pissss, trains always delayed, fares increase with no betterment of their services. Always on strike when they earn more than most of the population. 

Couldn't even run a bath

items.title: Disgusting Negligence
items.review_text: Staff at Sevenoaks are not fit for purpose. Can’t even look customers in the eye and give accurate advice about train times or anything related . Couldn’t give a damn about customer service. Disgraceful! Get your act together.

items.title: We ordered tickets online
items.review_text:
We ordered tickets online. Initially e tickets with my husbands railcard. Payment pending but no e tickets received. 
He then spoke with a customer advisor online who said they money would be sent back and not taken. 
He then ordered again to collect at the station. Exactly the same scenario. 
By the next day, the day of our travel no tickets still received but 2 payments pending. 
We ended up having to purchase the tickets at the station office.
A concern has been formally raised as the initial 2 payments were taken but still no refund has been received, even though we have submitted bank statements and receipts as requested. 
We are still awaiting a £114.05 refund nearly 2 weeks after we initially paid for thus!!!!!  A journey to London return has so far cost us nearly £180

Complaint no : SE1788097

items.title: Monday 15th of april
items.review_text: Monday 15th of april, trains towards hayes from 6pm were all cancelled. Due to "tree on the railway." Next day, Tuesday morning trains from hayes to London at 6:30am cancelled due to fire on the railway truck. What a joke lol

items.title: The worst
items.review_text: The worst. Regular user of this awful train unfortunately as my work requires me to take it, next choose is the bus. Always delayed or cancelled, last min, quite often you are informed when you just arrived at the station. Avoid it at all cost. Smelly, dirty trains that are overpriced with poor quality service. Looking forward for this company to go bankrupt!

items.title: Worst trains in europe
items.review_text: Worst trains in europ. I have been travel from London bridge to Dartford. Train wad old, stinky even worst than trains in Romanian

items.title: SOUTHEASTERN trying to evade paying delay repay
items.review_text:
This company is a joke and there delay repay doesn't work. I bought a peak ticket from Greenhithe to London Terminals on 2nd April 2024. I took the 08:00 train to London Waterloo East which departed 12 minutes late. We were then told that the train will be cancelled in London Bridge which we got there at 09:11. I then waited for another train on the other of the platform to get to Waterloo East which was by the way packed like sardines due to the cancellation. I arrived in Waterloo East just under 30 minutes later. I submitted a delay repay and got rejected 3 times. I don't know if they company is recording their trains that are running late correctly so that they won't issue delay repay to their customer. I normally buy off peak but this day I had to be in the office at a certain time due to a meeting which I was 30 mins late due to this very UNRELIABLE train company.

P.S. When the train was delayed on that day I took a screenshot when I got to London Bridge which was taken at 09:11. The time on the app showed that the train arrived from Greenhithe to London Bridge at 08:45 even it didnt. Watch out other commuters as this company is trying to evade paying delay repay to their paying customers.

items.title: Constant delays and cancels
items.review_text: Constant delays and cancels, over priced tickets for dirty train seats that are not cleaned. Along with rail strikes making the southeastern line unreliable.

items.title: Crap experience. Standing room only
items.review_text: Strike on Monday. Bought a ticket for 3:23 Cbw to STP. NO SEATS! Ridiculous. Tried to get on an earlier train that had plenty of seats but wanted to charge in excess of 50 gbp. In 3 cars there were 20-30 people standing. No management. Crap experience

items.title: Honestly dont know what planet these…
items.review_text: Honestly dont know what planet these guys are on!!! I travel everyday and guess what?? I'm late everyday, takes a month to get refunded, never seen a company just completely drop their customers because of their own faults, honestly don't know how they are even still a company, every single day same story, awful customer service

items.title: We used S E rail services yesterday at…
items.review_text: We used S E rail services yesterday at Maidstone West, Strood, Margate and Chatham stations. At every one there were people available to help and advise. They were all friendly , happy and knowledgeable, and gave us expert advice about our journey. The lady at Strood around 11.30 was particularly helpful with a phone problem where our tickets were stored. Well done, at last it was a pleasure to use the railway!

items.title: Scam company!
items.review_text:
My train was cancelled at the last minute when I arrived the station without any reason any notice, which caused me so much fuss! 
Tried to get refund, you know what, their customer service just doesn’t respond! I sent emails and called, but nobody answered. Been months now. 
This operator is basically a scam company, they cancel trains all the time and never return the money to you! Please avoid this doggy railway even though you can get cheaper tickets, not worth taking the risk.

items.title: A Regular
items.review_text: Once again, 3rd time in a space of two weeks. Catching the connection from Stratford to Ashford to Rye is a complete failure to whomever runs these operations! When you train arrives at Ashford and you can see your connection on the opposite side moving from 5-1 to find it leaving, on 3 seprate occasions when the time difference is 10 minutes and it leaves earlier than it should. Your incompetence is costing us an extra hour of our time. The incompetence is appalling.

items.title: Travelling to Hampshire
items.review_text:
A massive thankyou to all the guys who helped me get to my daughters.  Every step of the way someone met me from the train, carried my bags, got me on the next train made sure I was comfortable and passed me on to someone for the next part of my journey This service really was excellent. I'm not sure I would've got there without the assistance they gave.
 So to the bosses at southeastern and South Western trains, your staff need to be applauded, each and every one of the them were outstanding and again I thank you 🥰

items.title: Southeastern railways consistently delayed
items.review_text: Southeastern railways have stopped direct trains from Cannon Street to Hayes line, resulting in changes at London Bridge, but the trains are consistently delayed! Departure delays even by a few minutes result in missing my connecting train, had to wait 15mins for the next train which was also delayed out of Charing Cross. To make matters worse, they don't even factor in that the delays from Cannon Street could result in the customer having to wait further 15mins, plus any delays to that service. Delays to both trains meant a journey that should takes less than 30mins, took close to 55mins, resulting in less family time! A very unhappy customer.

items.title: Bad. Just bad.
items.review_text: These window-lickers can never get their trains here on time. They don't give a steaming schit about those who have jobs to go to, and these entitled spastics will say "MuH i'M gOiNg On StRiKe" when expected to actually do their job. Making me want to move back to Dagenham 😂😂

items.title: Disgusting service from staff members
items.review_text: I already purchased my train ticket on VirginTrain app and just needed to collect my ticket at Stratford station for travel. In order to collect the ticket form the machine, the machine required a physical card to be inserted (though they will not take any money). I did not have any other cards except my AMEX card which the machine refused to accept so I approached the ticket office. There was only one officer at the ticket office and there were two group of people in front of me, one group was on the side because of a ticket on a machine but didn’t get their ticket - that machine do not belong to southeastern - you can tell that it will take ages for this group due to the issue. He served the second group on the queue first instead, then he refused to serve me. I explained that I just needed to collect the ticket, the train is in 5 minutes, I literally needed two minutes for the ticket to be printed for me and I cannot collect from the machine because I do not have a card. He refused and ask me to step aside and say I can miss the train and there will be other trains - I needed to be on that train to be home before 4:30 for an appointment. I explained the same to another female officer at the barrier, who probably heard the conversation and also refused to let me through despite showing confirming of booking with exact time of the train. Im totally uttered service. They charging a fortune and increase the price everyday yet a lot of the times we’re required to stand throughout the journey - I travel on south eastern at least twice a week and 50% of the time I am standing with no seat. Of course I have no choice but to still travel with them because they’re the only train provider from Folkestone to St Pancras/Stratford internationals but I have to put this review here. I also feel discriminated by the officer at the ticket office, served the individual before me but not me. They were all white and I’m Asian. Maybe I’m over thinking but I am strongly feeling that race plays a part here.

items.title: Member of staff at Chatham who went above and beyond
items.review_text:
I was not very well getting off of a train at Chatham station on Sunday 25th February. The Southeastern member of staff on the gate at Chatham was extremely polite and friendly. He kindly got me 2 cups of water which helped so much. 
I have spoken to him today and thanked him so much for his help and he was totally humble. 
Your member of staff Radu Vornicu is a credit to your company. 
Thanks again from a satisfied passenger.

items.title: They quite literally don't give a toss
items.review_text:
I used to have the misfortune of having to use the southeastern trains franchise. It was awful. Ridiculously expensive, glacially slow trains, dirty, poor facilities, just a terrible, terrible service and gradually getting worse year on year.

In the last 3 years I have only had to use their 'service' if you can call it that, 3 times. Twice the train hasn't turned up at all, this time there were 4 changes. It's not just the 100% unreliability score, its the  couldnt-give-a-damn customer services. Ticket office open for about 12 minutes a week, ticket machines broken, a pathetically convoluted system to buy a parking ticket, waiting rooms locked. 

The whole thing is farcical. In any other country in the world this would not be tolerated.

Everyone had high hopes after Go Ahead got sacked that the service would improve but all that happened is once again the old phrase proves true; you can't polish a ****

items.title: Trains that reek of pee…
items.review_text:
Trains that reek of pee and haven't been properly maintained let alone cleaned since they came into service 30 years ago. Endless cancellations and mid-journey breakdowns. And that's before we get onto the days lost to strikes. Stations are old and decrepit. Staff are a mixed bag. 

Let TfL take over this shambles of an operator at least on the London metro routes. At least they know what they're doing.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text:
Terrible service. An incident with two of their ticket inspectors who were shouting at the passengers without being provoked at any way and also were extremely verbally aggressive. The case was also reported to the British Transport Police.

Southeastern fully neglected the case without the matter it was in their scope.

What kind of gang company is this?! It looks like they give a lot of money to somebody to keep operating there!

items.title: Using public transport after years of…
items.review_text: Using public transport after years of driving and well, using Southeastern trains has been undesirable. Firstly, their toilets on the trains are mostly out of order and the toilets that are working are filthy, smell and have no toilet paper. A train worker told us, "Yeah, they haven't been cleaned since yesterday" with no care at all. Secondly, I found trains are often on different platforms to the what the computer screens tell you. Staff told us which platform to get one train, only 2 minutes later another member of staff telling us a different platform, and the way in which he told us was he couldn't be bothered to even communicate with us and continue his conversation with somebody else.

items.title: Piroty seating.
items.review_text: Can not complain about delays as they are only a few minutes late.  But what is the point on having piority seating when the train I get on in the morning to go to work the seats are taken up by South eastern staff, this needs to change.  So I would of given more stars but this happens every day I go to work and has been happening for months.

items.title: ever fewer trains
items.review_text: Southeastern's proposed June timetable has removed 2 fast trains from Orpington to London Bridge. There is now a 38 minute gap between trains. Sevenoaks has 15 minute gaps

items.title: Filthy, smelly trains!
items.review_text: I regularly use Southeastern services between Cannon Street and Chatham, the trains are always, and everyday very filthy. Today around 6pm, I boarded my train, and there was not one clean seat. All the seats had crumbs on it, very dusty and very dirty. There was a weird dampy smell throughout the train as well. In addition, the trains are never maintained properly. The doors separating the carriages half the time don’t even open properly, or on my train, only half the door opens but immediately slams shut. The windows are so rusty you can’t even open them. Yet year on year my fares are sky rocketing and I’m reading on the news that railway fares are set to go up AGAIN in April? Where’s all the revenue from fares going because it’s clearly evident that Southeastern does not hire any cleaners. I understand it may be difficult to keep clean trains throughout the day but at 7.30am somedays? Come on! I mean I never see anyone picking up litter in the trains in between services. I can guarantee you they probably last cleaned the seats 15 years ago. A very shambolic organisation. I haven’t touched upon the reliability of services, but as many other reviews will tell you, constant cancellations, and I was once told by Station staff at Cannon Street that there was a shortage of drivers, and 2 services were cancelled. This is actually pathetic, considering the DFT directly runs and operates Southeastern!

items.title: I wouldn't even give 1 star if I could
items.review_text: I wouldn't even give 1 star if I could. Absolutely incompetent staff who don't know what they are doing, have nothing but problems with their trains, and customer service, I have no option to use them because of where I live, but it's just awful !

items.title: I use SE for a relatively short commute…
items.review_text: I use SE for a relatively short commute into Victoria. The service itself is very good, with infrequent delays and cancellations. Frequency of 4 trains an hour during peak times is good. However, the trains have not been refurbished since being introduced over 30 years ago! There's years of grime on the heaters, dirty, torn or broken seats and dirty floors. In general, pretty disgusting. The other operators in the region such as Southern and Southwestern have much cleaner, modern interior trains, even when they are using older rolling stock

items.title: Reliable and friendly
items.review_text: I moved to SE London in 2022 and if it wasn’t for Southeastern Railway, I wouldn’t have been able to get to and from central London so easily (especially in such a sparse area of the TFL network!) The staff are always friendly and the trains are reliable. I’m moving from the area soon, so just wanted to express my thanks for your services!

items.title: Unreliable
items.review_text: Unreliable, trains are regularly late. Often trains get diverted and passengers are left stranded 1.5 hours and £100 away from their destination.

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: I’ve used Southeastern trains a dozen times in the past 3 weeks and every single train has been delayed or cancelled. The trains are dirty and understaffed, there are no apologies for lateness or cancellations. This company has been terrible for years but is getting progressively worse week on week.

items.title: Would just like to thank the lovely…
items.review_text: Would just like to thank the lovely Janene & Tom @ stratford international for their informative, friendly and exceptional service received tonight! Also the absolute sort who stopped me from going the wrong way she had short cropped blonde hair and was operating the train from Stratford International to St pancreas approx 11.50pm you were so helpful and lovely sorry I don't remember your name xx

items.title: OUTSTANDING customer service received…
items.review_text: OUTSTANDING customer service received for retrieving a lost bag. My husband left his bag (with passport) on the train whilst coming to visit me for our 20 week first babys can in Paris, the station staff at Greenwich and particularly Ryan at the Southeastern customer call centre couldn't have doke enough to help us. The fast actions fo the staff going above and beyond their job meant he was able to retrieve his passport the same day and still join me in Paris for the scan. We cannot thank Southeastern enough!

items.title: Disgusting service
items.review_text:
Disgusting service, always delays and cancellations. 
Don't want to refund for constant bad service! Always the customer out of pocket so the fat cats get richer.
Understand works need to be done, if course. But on a bank holiday? Why not overnight? Give people a lot more notice of planned works. Bring back British Rail and get rid of these privatised companies!!!

items.title: The agony and misery of SE trains
items.review_text: I would leave no stars or minus stars for this tragedy of a train service. I have been in contact with my local MP so many times about it. My trains are always late, always and my partner only yesterday experienced a 2.40 hour journey which should have taken less than an hour. It might be slightly more tolerable if it wasn't for their astronomical fare costs. Sad.

items.title: Absolutely shocking service
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking service since the new timetable has been introduced! Train delays and overcrowding as the amount of training have been reduced during the rush hour.  Certain lines you can’t even get to Charing Cross without having to change at London Bridge.  Who does this benefit? Certainly not the paying passengers!

items.title: Returning from London to Folkestone
items.review_text: Returning from London to Folkestone. Train broke down between Westernhanger and Sanding. Over 30 mins delay. Nothing new or Supriseing.Tippical of the service you get from this cowboy 🤠 company. 3 times this year I have been involved with a train breakdown . It's hight time this company lost there franchise.

items.title: Possibly the world's worst train service
items.review_text: Unfortunately for me, I have had to use the Southeastern service from Sittingbourne to Gillingham for a number of years and more recently from Sittingbourne to Canterbury East. I would be hard pressed to describe how dreadful the train service Southeastern provide is. You are faced with constant cancellations, delays or no service at all.  Replacement bus services at weekends are common place.   I was late for work this morning due to yet another cancellation. On cold winter mornings, the waiting room is often closed.  You are lucky if you can get a seat. For this, I have to pay sky high ticket prices.  I would give Southeastern's service 0 stars were it possible.   An absolutely disgusting joke of a train service.

items.title: Always a really pleasant ticket buying experience.
items.review_text:
The Lewisham DLR and National Rail Station is run by South Eastern and employs a delightful lady called Paulette who  frequently helps me find tickets for sometimes quite complicated journeys involving my activities as a senior surgeon. Nothing is ever too much trouble for this good humoured, charming and helpful person and she goes out of her way to make sure I get the best price and train times for my journeys. This makes such a refreshing change from so many other employees us customers have to deal with who just want to move on to the next customer as quickly as possible. 
Who would ever want to use a ticket machine when you can have service like this? Already looking forward to book my next journey!

items.title: Reasonable when I've used them.
items.review_text: So far using SE Trains has always been OK, even if the so called High Speed service averages 42mph from my station. What has prompted me to leave 4 stars was the prompt refund from customer service after the online purchase tickets could not be used. Had the staff at the station (who had a leaflet to save their jobs) been more helpful it would have been 5.

items.title: Southeastern are an absolute shambles
items.review_text:
Southeastern are an absolute shambles. Most trains are late and overcrowded. The new time table is absurd, most scheduled running times have increased and you can’t get directly to most destinations you would want to go.
Finally tfl build a tube to the southeast and immediately southeastern stop you being able to reach it.
Government need to act swiftly.
APPALLING

items.title: They don’t deserve more pay!!
items.review_text: I’m not ever exaggerating anymore this is actually rubbish service. I’m gonna be real why are they striking if you can’t do your job right don’t strike it’s not our fault that none of you can do your job.

items.title: No consideration for customers
items.review_text: Because one of your trains broke down and the 1510 was 10 minutes late departing Victoria you decided that it would run fast to Gillingham, missing out three stations. There is now an 8.5 month pregnant lady crying and stranded at Victoria Station with all of your staff totally ignoring her. Good job Southeastern. Very customer focused decision making.

items.title: Bus Replacement …
items.review_text:
This relates to the Bus Replacement  service whilst work was being  carried  out between  Strood  and Rainham  on  Sunday June 4
The bus was packed with people standing  for the replacement  service,which was not only uncomfortable, noisy but verging on organised  chaos and dangerous. Why carry out  planned works in the height of Summer. I like South Eastern Trains but this ruined my trip and took twice as long,having  only discovered  this after booking an essential  journey.

items.title: Really bad.
items.review_text:
I've had the misfortune of having to use Southeastern for many years to commute. I can honestly say, I don't recall them ever arriving at the London destination on time. Once, the driver made an announcement, celebrating the fact that the train had arrived only ten minutes late. A rare achievement.
Toilets are not cleaned, carriages stink like a sewer.
Massively expensive.
Post covid, they are even worse.
 They now take failure to new levels.
They are a blight on my life.

items.title: Disgusting service and Disgusting…
items.review_text: Disgusting service and Disgusting trains . Always delayed or cancelled, never on time. Trains are old and ran down,extremely dirty, seats are filthy, floors covered with rubbish, toilets full of faeces, no air-conditioning,extremely hot ( to the point it could be life threatening) and smelly. Avoid at all cost!!!

items.title: Delayed trains forced me to run and…
items.review_text: Delayed trains forced me to run and catch a train on other platforms. I bought ticket for a next   trip when I was mid journey and didn't realize that train line app gave me only code. On final destination they fine me 116£ for having only code and not a physical ticket which I couldn't print because delayed trains. Bad service and I will never travel by train in UK again. On top of that I can't pay fine because website doesn't work and phone number that was in penalty fare notice is all the time busy.

items.title: Must do better
items.review_text:
The 11 December timetable changes are thinly disguised downgrades in service. Fewer trains; delays and cancellations as before.

Many of the trains have no toilets on board and those that have often have toilets out of order. By the way, teenage boys often break the toilet door mechanisms for fun which leads to toilets falling into disrepair.

The new City Beam trains cause motion sickness. Seat fabric is often torn / worn on older Networker trains.

The Delay Repay compensation system rarely seems to pay out. Ticket prices are high for a substandard service. Stations are often unstaffed and facilities often locked shut.

And Southeastern wonder why people prefer the new Elizabeth Line ..?

items.title: Worse than 25 years ago takes longer…
items.review_text: Worse than 25 years ago takes longer and harder to plan - to get to work in London than back then haha ridiculous really in modern 2023 slow and guaranteed that another train will speed past you when you are sitting at a red light or not premium service !! Disgusting and obviously paying more for less and more hassle !!!!!

items.title: I don’t understand what’s the point of…
items.review_text: I don’t understand what’s the point of having this railway line when the service is so poor. Too many delays and cancellations with no explanation.

items.title: Pathetic
items.review_text: Purchased a ticket online the day before travel to pick up at Ramsgate station on day of travel. When I arrived both ticket office positions were closed and there was a queue at the ticket machine. It took me 15 minutes to get my tickets and I came close to missing my train. I was travelling to hospital for an operation that I've been waiting months for that had already been cancelled twice. Fortunately I arrived at the hospital on time. I complained to Southeastern and was told that the ticket office was closed due to staff annual leave! What sort of a company doesn't allow for cover when arranging annual leave? I've never worked for one. For my follow up appointments, I will be using the bus. It may take longer, but it's cheaper. Pathetic.

items.title: Nationalise public transport
items.review_text: Nationalise this company immediately. Private owners are clearly incompetent. An average of 1.6/5 stars from reviews shows something needs to be done before the owners/operators run themselves into the ground. Joke of a company honestly you'd be better off investing in a horse and cart than using any of southeastern services. We have regressed progress In 20 years. I'm impressed how inept you can be with no consequences.

items.title: Good customer service
items.review_text: Trains were delayed which wasn't great but can't be helped. Two lovely members of staff at London Victoria and Faversham approached us and ensured that we knew of the platform changes which I thought it was good customer service.

items.title: So inflexible
items.review_text: So inflexible. Its not worth even travelling into London anymore with the ever increasing prices, constant strikes and lack of flexibility when buying tickets. I purchased tickets in advance but had to cancel at short notice. Unfortunately I couldn't change them to the dates i needed or get a refund. Tried changing tickets online but wouldn't give me any decent options. I used to travel every week to London but fortunately I only need to go in once a month now (as we can work from home) and you even manage to make this one journey difficult. Your lack of respect for customers is driving them away in droves.

items.title: F#cking hate this sh#t service
items.review_text: F#cking hate this sh#t service, all a bunch of old c#nts with no life but the one at the station, living just so they can abuse their power, if i could i would never have to travel with these vermin pr1cks again. Only good part of this train service is when you see one of the train inspectors stack it, makes my day.

items.title: Routinely screwed over on the line back…
items.review_text: Routinely screwed over on the line back from Ashford to Maidstone. Timetable shifts mean you can wait for an hour and half for a scheduled train after the high speed arrives whereas all the over lines have trains going within 10 minutes. Then if there is a delay they will screw over the Maidstone line by either going faster to Bromley or cancelling the trains. Typically if the Charing X line via Tonbridge line is delayed by 20 minutes you’re looking at an hour + delay on the Maidstone line.

items.title: My school aged son has to get a…
items.review_text: My school aged son has to get a southeastern train home and I feel so sorry for him. The train is regularly cancelled or delayed with no notice. I check the app and try to warn him, but most of the time the app isnt even updated until the train is already late or cancelled. Bunch of cowboys running an overpriced joke service.

items.title: Ticket Officer
items.review_text:
Karlene at Bickley station helped me obtain the cheapest fare and looked up times of trains for my journey. B buying a senior rail pass I actually paid the same as I would have done without the pass, so in fact I now have a rail card for a year which will considerably reduce cost in future...
Hannah Edmonds

items.title: I'm a Canadian that was visiting family…
items.review_text:
I'm a Canadian that was visiting family in Horsham
I went to the train ticket operator and bought a pair of tickets to Dover to tour Dover castle. 
On the return from Dover I asked when the train to London Bridge was arriving and the Southern operator pointed out that the route through Tonbridge is faster and half price.
I filed a complaint ad southeastern said they couldn't do anything about it but I could file with an Ombudsman.
They would not apologize or accept responsibility for a mistake being made. If Southeastern is going to take advantage of tourists then this review serves as a warning not to trust Southeastern they just want as much of your money with out having accountability.
Mistakes are made it how they handle correcting the mistake that either builds or erodes confidence in their service

items.title: Thank you Southeastern Railway for…
items.review_text: Thank you Southeastern Railway for spoiling my Sunday !!! Purchased my ticket for a timed train, knowing that the train was delayed with a fault. Train was then cancelled. Went back to ticket office to get refund but have to use delay repay !!! Poor Service again !! Staff that don’t care and just sit around giving no customer service and you strike expecting sympathy!!!! Try giving a decent reliable clean service!!!!!

items.title: What a useless company charging nearly…
items.review_text: What a useless company charging nearly £40 to travel before 10.20 st pancras to Herne bay and to add insult to injury having to go on a coach making you 1 hour travel longer if you're a senior go by coach less than £5 anytime without a coach card

items.title: Southeastern booking system best avoided
items.review_text:
Southeastern booking system is best avoided.
After a year or more of UK rail strikes, the Southeastern booking system remains unclear on the validity of tickets following strike days, inflexible and unhelpful. 
The only way to get an answer, eg if strikes delay your journey, is to contact a human at a station ticket office to find out if your ticket is still valid for a later date.
Even AI cannot fix this: try the website and spend harmless hours going around in circles. Guaranteed time wasting examples:
Online chat goes nowhere, can only deal with the most basic standard queries.
The 0345 322 7021 helpline number strangely connects with TFL on one option, for no obvious reason.
The 61016 text number is for POLICE only.
Online queries and refunds only cover the southeastern part of any journey, not any onward travel tickets purchased on Southeastern.
The online form does not appear to have a "send" button?
Tried WhatsApp:- no reply.
In the event of a strike or other problem affecting Southeastern trains - you may realise that you should have booked on any other online booking system.

items.title: Beware, do not insert cash into their vending machines unless you want to lose it!
items.review_text: I inserted £20 note into one of their vending machines at London Bridge and then the screen got frozen. As a result I didn’t receive my ticket and also wasn’t able to get my £20 back. One of the cashiers in their ticket office claimed she went to check the machine but my money wasn’t there! Overall the staff was unhelpful, smirky and unapologetic. Absolutely outrageous! Still wondering what happened to my money

items.title: Train toilets.
items.review_text: Obviously no publicly used toilet is a nice place to be at anytime but the toilets on Southeastern trains are a BIOHAZARD!! The absolute disgusting smell that emits from these facilities is truly sickening at times enough to make you want to vomit. Fair enough avoid the toilet carriage and sit on another carriage if seats are available or stand in another carriage if not. The smell from the train toilet is even present before you enter the train! Sort it out ffs. Surely there is a chemical that can be used/introduced to the system to help maintain the smell of what can only be described as rotting faeces. And to my fellow commuters close the door when you've finished your dump you filthy f*c#ing s*it$.

items.title: Helpful employee at Sevenoaks
items.review_text:
Thank you to the Southeastern employee at Sevenoaks Station who helped me on Friday 23rd June at approximately 9pm. Sorry, didn't get his name. 
I wasn't familiar with Sevenoaks station & needed to get home but wasn't sure of the route & needed help with the ticket machine. The employee spotted that I looked a bit confused & immediately offered to help, which was much appreciated! Thank you.

items.title: My journey to work and back is delayed…
items.review_text: My journey to work and back is delayed four days out of five on average and in both directions. The trains are grubby toilets regularly out of action and lifts and escalators at stations not working. Loads of staff milling about at ticket barriers until the service fouls up and then there’s no one to be seen. Increasingly vague excuses for delayed services: This train is delayed owing to a problem under investigation or a fault on an earlier train. These things may or may not be true but when you get a completely different excuse on the train, it doesn’t instil confidence. Increasing fares, the prospect of more strikes and a failed new timetable just compounds matters.

items.title: Generally good and striving to be better
items.review_text: I generally like the SE service, most of the time I have no issues and trains run on time. There have been a few delays in recent weeks, and last week I travelled on an extremely overcrowded train, as only four coaches turned up instead of eight. The conductor was puzzled about it himself. I have had issues with some staff in the past (unhelpful person at the ticket desk, who refused to issue tickets, “computer-says-no” train guard), but hey, someone has to employ these people too, otherwise they would be on benefits. Definitely not all rosy. But nothing that cannot be addressed through adequate training and culture sessions. I also just received a letter with apologies for recent issues, which tells me they are looking to get things right. I would say one of the better train companies I have used in the UK.

items.title: Terrible train line
items.review_text: Terrible train line. The service is rubbish. The staff on the platform is pretty poor. This morning I was on Dartford platform at 07:15 a.m. The train decide to change platform the train was announced for the people at the back  and in the middle. I asked someone they said platform 1 going to Luton and platform 2 is to Cannon Street I suppose. I am in the platform waiting for 07:54 a.m superb well done they keep increasing the fares. Rubbish transport system

items.title: Thanks to Jimmy and Nevy for the…
items.review_text: Thanks to Jimmy and Nevy for the helpful guidance to see my 4yr old’s mother off to Kent for the weekend via South Eastern Railway. Also, nice touch to let us onto the platform to sit and train-watch with my little one as the train to Ashford pulls out of the station.

items.title: False information, complete disregard for customer service and feedback.
items.review_text: Pre booked E-tickets on 03/04/24 for the 10:36am service. Upon arrival on 04/04/24 10:36am service was supposedly non-existent (never entered service) there were trains before but they all departed far too early from stations (this was according to the southeastern app and online) the only information displayed online and via app as well on the station was the 11:28 service. I needed to get to an important medical appointment in Ashford and couldn't attend unfortunately as the 11:28 service was far too late. Also trying to claim full refunds for this. Once again, proved to be utterly useless for customer feedback and services, from the southeastern website online, via the app and also from the southeastern company themselves in person. (Staff on station, including security, ticket officers and station management) This is by far not the first time I have had this experience. I will be informing the southeastern company headquarters again (not the first time I have done this)  also as always I presume I will get no reply because I don't usually get a response. The Southeastern Railway company in my opinion is completely ridiculous and I feel like nothing has been done addressed to meet any issues that are arrising constantly. Trains are never up to standards in hygiene and cleanliness, all services are never usually on time. Staff are not particularly helpful either in they way that they don't normally seem to know or have much experience. Basically everything is wrong and needs to be improved drastically. How more incompetent can you get. I really have had enough of Southeastern Railway and their business. Not good, not good at all.

items.title: Removal of Cannon Street loop service via Sidcup and Woolwich Arsenal.m
items.review_text: South Eastern railway are now axing the half hourly loop train service that runs from Cannon Street via Sidcup and woolwich Arsenal so there will be no connection to the new Elizabeth Line. There was no formal consultation with the public on this change as the government allowed this to happen. The new timetable without this loop service has now come into force and they have no plans to reinstate it.

items.title: The trains are either late or early
items.review_text: The trains are either late or early ! I’ve noticed over the last year or two they are often leaving 1-2 minutes early to reach the next destination, which is unacceptable. You cannot travel into London from Kent at the weekend due to engineering works almost every Sunday and the prices are sky high. The station staff have a difficult job, but they are often abrupt and discourteous to passengers.  The HS1 works well but again, frequently not available weekends. SouthEastern are very hot on checking tickets yet provide few facilities. Often no toilets, no toilets on the station, no refreshments and overall, just sub standard in terms of quality of service. No first class either now! It was far far better in the 80’s when I was a child. I love trains but I so wish we had a proper service. It’s just not acceptable and compared to Europe - well it’s shambolic.

items.title: Thursday 23rd March 8pm absolute chaos
items.review_text: Thursday 23rd March 8pm absolute chaos, no Hastings trains, advised to get the slow Sevenoaks train then hope for rhe best! Hastings train arrived Sevenoaks  2230 so journey delayed by 1hr 5 mins. Completed delay repay and refunded £2.40 on a £19 fare.

items.title: Now,there is a new trend,driver is on…
items.review_text: Now,there is a new trend,driver is on the train at Victoria Station but does not open doors,causing queues to get on the train

items.title: strike action again & no refund
items.review_text: If I could give zero stars I would. Strike action again & no refund for the day I had to make a 70 mlie round trip just to get into work. Some of us who are self-employed don't have the option of striking, if I don't get into work I don't get paid, simple. And to make to worse Southeastern won't refund the days travel becace of some clause they have, very convinent. And on top of that old trains with broken toilets and a reduced service How can these companies justify an reason not to refund for any reason. Automate the trains get rid of ticket offices and takeaway the franchises that a rodding the avarage man for just trying to get to work

items.title: Feel let down
items.review_text: My wife and I haven't been to London for years, booked  train tickets last week for our anniversary to see the Palace. Now there is a train strike, so I'm driving instead and will always drive in future, rather than rely on Southeastern Railway.

items.title: just awful service
items.review_text:
price on there website, £27.00 london return, same ticket same journey,  on National Rail website  £24.

tried for 1 hour to buy tickets, the website crashes.

decided to get a taxi to london for the funeral.
i think this company is a joke. terrible service.

how can they have a price for there trian £3 more expensive than national rail.!

items.title: There needs to be a serious review of…
items.review_text:
There needs to be a serious review of Southeastern railway.
Dreadful service dangerous conditions on London Bridge station in the evenings due to overcrowding and sudden platform changes 
A journey home that should take 50 mins is now taking an hour and a half due to constant delays and cancellations.The new timetable that was launched recently is an unmitigated disaster they  need to go back and start again
People have returned to work  and need a service that reflects the demand it should be a far better service it’s not free we are paying very high prices and are being treated appallingly

items.title: I pay £4,500 for a season ticket and…
items.review_text:
I pay £4,500 for a season ticket and the service is shocking. The trains are filthy, they always run late and the staff are rude. 

Definitely not value for money.

items.title: Wheelchair travel
items.review_text: I want to thank the helpful staff at Tonbridge and Charing Cross Stations for really looking after us when we took my mum up to her hospital appointment. They phoned ahead to make sure the wheelchair access ramps were available at both ends of the journey and made what could have been a very stressful day so much easier! The staff on the trains were excellent too. Thank you.

items.title: Excellent Caring Employees
items.review_text: I've been using the Southeastern Railway for almost a year now (Victoria - Herne Hill). Yes, there are some delays and cancellations, but most of the employees are simply wonderful, and this is what really makes a difference. I would like to express an immense gratitude to Demis (at Herne Hill) and Sharon (Penge East) for helping me find the lost property. They were super efficient and jumped to help right away when I left my company's property on the train by accident, in the evening of November 15th, 2023. The lost item was found at Penge East due to an excellent team work between Demis and Sharon. I felt protected and cared for. This is a great relief to know how much the employees care about customers and how hard they work to help. I'm beyond grateful to Demis and Sharon for their kindness, support and professionalism that helped us find the lost item, which I thought was impossible...

items.title: Southeastern are absolutely useless
items.review_text: Southeastern are absolutely useless.  It's impossible to plan childcare as you never know when you will get home. They introduced a new timetable which has caused havoc I guess that was their plan. Sevenoaks trains to and from grove park are a joke. Always delayed or late. Continous signaling issues, lack of communication.  If you are after that type of service then Southeastern is the train company for you! If I could I would give them minus 5

items.title: Disgusting. Constant delays and cancellations
items.review_text:
Constant delays, cancellations and overcrowding. One train late 30 mins the one after cancelled. And the train driver helpfully suggesting finding alternative services to ease overcrowding.  This is week after week. 
Absolutely disgusting to be a hostage to this 'service' and be paying through the nose for the privilege

items.title: Overhead power cable snapped!
items.review_text: So today we had the overhead power cable snap and shower the train in sparks before coming to a halt on its way to London from Ebbsfleet.The carriage had smoke and a strong smell of electrical burning. We’ve been stuck for hours waiting for a recovery train but that’s not the point - the young lady Charlotte (train manager) did a fantastic job making sure everyone was ok and spent her entire time speaking to people on the train to keep us all updated. Not the best day for travel but things happen don’t they? Well done Charlotte and all the team that helped us change trains. Very professional, thank you.

items.title: people with no souls
items.review_text: southeastern people with no souls. one of there mangers thought she could do here own thery on my mental health even thou i was geetig sectiond she also got her staff to call my die in mum a prozzy. then they expect us to be on side when they go on strike hope thy all die  like southeastern deserve to lose their jobs

items.title: I only gave that 2nd star because…
items.review_text: I only gave that 2nd star because occasionally everything will be as planned on my journey. It is disgraceful having to pay that amount of money in comparison to the unreliable service we get for it. But hey, it’s not like I’m going to stop using the railway.. I’m still gonna take that train to go to work tomorrow so I can eat :)

items.title: Excellent Service
items.review_text: Yesterday I travelled from London to Canterbury West from St Pancras on the Margate train. It was the 16.46. I think. The train was on good time, clean and with excellent facilities for phone charging too. When  I alighted at Canterbury West the station was busy and staff were vigilant the whole time ensuring passengers needing assistance  alighted and boarded safely. The platform was clean and tidy and there was just a sense of all the staff  being totally engaged and providing a great service to the passengers they served. Some went above and beyond anything I would have expected of them! I left my phone plug  on the train to Margate and spoke to John and his colleague  who were on duty on the platform. They were just so pleasant and helpful and did all they could to retrieve my plug. They phoned ahead to Margate to let them know it was still on board, phoned me back an hour later to say it was recovered and I could pick it up the next day at Canterbury West which I have just done. Once again I was greeted with such kindness by staff on duty there today. Thank you John and Chris and the other staff at Canterbury West for a great job well done. I can’t thank you all enough for taking the time to do all you did and showing everyone there that despite what we read in the news etc there are still plenty of people in this country who DO take a pride in the job they do and make such a difference to those they come in contact with.

items.title: Terrible new timetable
items.review_text:
Terrible new timetable

Truly awful train company. I hate the new timetable with the enforced change of trains to get to Charing Cross. Journey times, which were already very slow are doubled to 40 minutes for a 7 mile journey and the trains are frequently late. The trains themselves are shabby, clapped out and often overcrowded too (to the extent that people can't board). This is blighting south east London, is detrimental to people's lives and needs sorting out quickly and above all BRING BACK THE DIRECT CHARING CROSS TRAINS.

items.title: Astonishingly filthy train to Hastings
items.review_text: Astonishingly filthy train to Hastings. Dirt inside and so filthy outside you can barely see through the windows. Surely cleaning a train is basic?

items.title: terrible
items.review_text: terrible. i was in a hurry to get on the next train after just getting off another, with no time to stop and buy a ticket. assuming i could buy one on the train. i then got on the train and was refused an option to buy a ticket and then was fined and told by the ticket inspector to “just appeal it online” i then attempted to appeal and was refused an appeal and have now been fined nearly £400 months later with no following emails, very poor.

items.title: Never known a more useless company…
items.review_text:
Never known a more useless company before in my life. I don’t think there is anything they can actually get right. They are completely unreliable, People have to rely on this company to get them to school college and work everyday with no option in the matter but they could not care less. Their staff are rude and act like they have the most power in the world and their trains are dirty. This company will allow you to give them your hard earned money everyday but only occasionally will you actually get some sort of service out of that money! (And don’t think you’re getting a refund for their unreliability!) 
Disgusting company.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service. High prices. Can’t remember the last time could get into London on the weekend. Either on strike or engineering works. Staff I’ve dealt with are no help, could automate a lot of the work and they would if it weren’t for the fact of a huge upfront cost. Don’t understand why the public who pay their wages have to suffer.

items.title: Absolutely appalling service
items.review_text:
Absolutely appalling service. I've been using the Hastings to London line for over 2 years now and it's absolute c**p. 
I have no idea why southeastern are so bad and this line in particular. The worst part is, they have you by the short and curlies seeing that they are the only train company operating on this line. 

To put this into context. The Brighton/Littlehampton to London route is far better. Trains run on time, most of the time, have either Thameslink, Southern, Gatwick Express, etc running up and down them. There's no monopoly there. 
Plus they run 24 hours, unlike the Hastings line which stops around midnight and doesn't start up again until gone 5am. 

If I had a choice, I wouldn't go anywhere near southeastern. This trainline needs to be handed over to Southern.

items.title: Nearly every service is late
items.review_text: Nearly every service is late. In peak rushour home they only run 1 train an hour and all 10 coaches are full to the brim. And just recently they decided to run the service with 4 coaches so half the people on the platform couldn't get on. And they offered no sort of replacement service. Other trains wer also late so missed connections.

items.title: Sub-par and horrendously expensive.
items.review_text: Driver apologised on the tannoy and advised we were entitled to claim a refund as there had been a delay of more than 15 minutes. Put a refund request through, which was declined as their records “show” there was no delay. Yet I arrived almost 20 minutes later than I was supposed to. What a waste of time. Have never claimed before, despite repeated delays. It’s a horrible service that costs a horrible amount of money.

items.title: Disgraceful  …
items.review_text:
Why are SE rail paying morons to do nothing and we don't need drivers 

Interchanged at London Bridge.... asked 3 SE staff why there are no trains to gravesend?   They went to pull out their mobiles.... I can do that!!  They should know why direct trains are missing.    
Waiting at Swanscombe Station.... witnessed a train 'driver entering the station on opposite platform... he had his feet up on dashboard  and was chilling!!!
Disgraceful   sack them all.

items.title: Dreadful service
items.review_text: The service provided by SE railway Is absolutely appalling. I wanted to get a TRAIN from Maidstone to folkestone, changing at Ashford International. Nobody said at the time of purchasing my ticket that there was a replacement BUS service. If I wanted to get a bus I would of got a bus. I do not support train strikes. They are charging the same price for tickets but providing less service. When I arrived at Ashford everyone wanted the bus leaving no room for others so I couldn't go. When I complained at Maidstone ticket office, the man on the desk claimed he had been telling everyone it was a bus service. I must have not heard that. He didn't tell me this and if he did, I wouldn't have gone. Their service is absolutely disgusting

items.title: If I could select no stars I would
items.review_text: If I could select no stars I would!  This is a disgrace of a service!! They have removed the Charing Cross service from a number of stations causing massive disruption for thousands of people.  They did this without consultation and ignoring petitions against this.  I am currently on a train having changed at Lewisham which is standing room only and like a commuter train at rush hour - it is Sunday.  There is considerable housing pressure in London and removing services that serve as a life line to the city is counterintuitive and utterly short sighted.  We struggle enough as it is in SE London with patchy transportation links.  The company needs to be held accountable and in my view someone more competent should be running these services!!!  Starting with the reinstatement of Charing Cross services.

items.title: One of the best staff at St John’s station
items.review_text:
Today I had to go to St John’s station as Brockley was closed I needed to get a ticket to beaconfield but I couldn’t add my railcard and the ticket office was closed, a very polite coloured lady offered to help as she saw how frustrated I was getting she let me use her hotspot so I could buy the ticket from my phone and then printed it off for me! Her customer service was 100 percent very nice helpful lady without her being there I would of been lost, I told my daughter how very helpful she was as a lot of people these days don’t help the OAP

Thankyou young lady

items.title: Train strikes left right and centre
items.review_text: Train strikes left right and centre. Can’t live your life anymore. So embarrassing. People get paid to much anyway. If anyone should be striking should be the NHS and the nurses who save people’s lives day in and out. They flick a switch and chose their own hours half the time and expect a pay rise every other week. It’s actually embarrassing. I’d rather walk then use south eastern again.

items.title: The worst customer service from the…
items.review_text: The worst customer service from the lady (short black hair) on High Brooms station! So rude and disrespectful! Not giving information about train!

items.title: Today Grove Park station train to…
items.review_text: Today Grove Park station train to Waterloo east is delayed again as always  for almost 20 minutes. This is always happening on a Sunday here. The Reason is due to shortage of the Train Crew’’. This should be escalated and someone needs to do something about it. I was late at work 😔Not a very good experience.

items.title: Never on time
items.review_text: It’s almost impossible to get to work on time because of southeastern train service, the amount of delays, faults, and on top of that strikes for pay raise which they don’t deserve at all. I wish to see better operational service provider running the area

items.title: Nonsense advice from customer services
items.review_text: Collecting tickets at Lenham, but machine broken and station locked up, so rang customer services. Guy said I had to have a valid ticket to travel and suggested I go to another station, collect my ticket and then return to Lenham. Got on the train and the conductor printed my tickets out with no problem.

items.title: Excellent service at Ashford international station …
items.review_text:
I  used passenger Assist at Ashford international Station yesterday to go to Charing Cross, I was greeted at the barrier by a lovely man who checked where I was going and the route had no issues. 
When I got to the platform Jey the mobile Assistant made himself known to me was helpful to where I needed to be to get on my train then got the ramps in place, ready for me to get on the train. He made sure I was I had everything I needed, said he would let Charing Cross know what carriage I was in so the would be ready at the station for my arrival. 
On Arrival at Charing Cross a lovely lady was there waiting. 
I was thoroughly impressed with the service I received from all staff who assisted me on this journey.

items.title: I like Southern Railway and its staff…
items.review_text:
I like Southern Railway and its staff members, but only from the Brighton part only, I am based in Brighton.
On the other hand, most staff from London are rude, unfriendly and lacking trait of treating people equally.

items.title: Always late, poor service, would not recommend!
items.review_text: Get on a train at a station with no ticket facilities and get issued a penalty fare charge of £50!!!! Your "authorised collector" E9020 is a jobsworth.

items.title: worst communication I've ever had.
items.review_text: Terrible experience! worst communication I've ever had. they are still on strike and canceling trains. when they do, they are often late. they charge a lot of money for tickets. the price is not adequate to the quality of services. I think it's ripping people off. I do not recommend

items.title: Typical terrible service we've come to expect
items.review_text: Nine times out of ten there's a delay, the service is abysmal and the fares are extortionate. This is the case with basically every train company so Southeaster aren't any worse than any of the others.

items.title: I  am in the process of being…
items.review_text: I  am in the process of being prosecuted by SE. This is a considerable privilege as I am being asked to prove I am not who they say I am by people who do not seem to know who they are. Unfortunately along the way we tried to have the magistrate prosecuted because se hide all traces of who they are and we assumed the wrong persons were the people involved. Not travelling on se could result in considerable penalties as a result of not travelling and all possible means of communicating with them been removed from the pages designed to enable you to communicate with them.  They have turned turned balls ups into an art form.

items.title: The government needs to intervene in…
items.review_text:
The government needs to intervene in this service and I will be writing to my MP and the Transport Secretary.
The service is a joke! I am seriously considering changing my job so I no longer need to get the train from Orpington station….
When will the government realise to repair the economy folks need to be able to get to work reliably and on time!

items.title: Completely useless and lazy
items.review_text: Completely useless and lazy. Operator is corrupt and trued to hide £25 million in tax payers money. Some staff need to recognise the times we’re in and stop holding workers to ransom.

items.title: Sitting on the floor of a busy street…
items.review_text: Sitting on the floor of a busy street is cleaner than getting on a southeastern train, completely disgusting, I think these trains haven't been cleaned in decades.  Not to mention the stations without infrastructure, they start a project and don't finish it, 3 years without covering the roof that was removed, trains delayed every day.

items.title: Absolutely useless!
items.review_text:
Absolutely useless!
If a train isn't cancelled it's delayed by half an hour. Going to be half an hour late for my uni lecture but feel likenI have to go because won't get a refund for delayed train, only get "compensation". This "compensation" is like £4... wow!
Are you serious? What am I going to do with the £4???!
You can take that £4 and shove it up your ass. Or better yet, use it to improve your rail system. Absolutely useless!

items.title: Dan was GREAT
items.review_text: Excellent time. I was on the 6.55AM train to London Victoria when I ran into Dan. He is an absolute credit to your team and a delight to have met. He was positive and friendly, greeted everyone with a smile and is one of the best guards I've ever seen. Please make sure he knows he's valued and appreciated.

items.title: Terrible ticket machine service London Bridge
items.review_text:
Terrible ticket purchasing service at London Bridge station. Despite recent refurbishment there are only a very small number of ticket machines and all of them had long queues. When I finally reached the start of the queue, I found that the new ticket machines do not provide the facility to buy a ticket starting from another station or zone. As I have a zone 1-6 travelcard, in order to buy a ticket, I had join another long queue at the small ticket office and most of the service windows there were closed. This delayed my journey significantly.

I think London Bridge southeastern ticket machines are the only ones in London that don't allow the customer to purchase a ticket that starts from another station. Very poor level of service.

items.title: This service is just a joke
items.review_text:
This service is just a joke. You go to the station thinking "fingers crossed, everything will be fine..."
And here we go, EVERY single day there is something that will delay, and often DOUBLE your commuting time.
Reasons we hear the most:
1 - Red signal failure
2 - "We are held just outside London Bridge station but we haven't been told why"
3 - Heavy rain
4 - Leaves on the rails
5 - Lack of train drivers
6 - Strike for whatever reason
7 - 3 cm of snow (oh my god, that tiny bit of snow must clearly stop the city from working!)

Whatever the reason is, rest ASSURED that you will be late for work.

What a joke!

items.title: Absolute poor advice
items.review_text: I asked for the last train to Gillingham from st pancras and was told 23.55 to faversham and when I got back  there wasn't any trains going past ebsfleet so I would give them a minus rating if I could. Totally untrustworthy as I could have gone directly to victoria if they had told the truth

items.title: How much slower could they go.
items.review_text: How much slower could they go. Seriously, Chuck another shovel of coal in. Walking pace from Northfleet to Gravesend? It’s 2033 not pre decimalisation.

items.title: Needing new and refreshed trains
items.review_text: In general works well specially if not on strike. Would say that half trains are in good condition and are new and the other half are very old, damaged and not event have A/C. With what they charge the quality expected would be much higher.

items.title: VERY POOR SERVICE
items.review_text: Soo poor get there a 17.20 needing to update the key card only to be told the person is on break and noone is covering the ticket office, when I got break at work I have someone to cover so the phones,office etc is not unattended and customers can be seen, atleast 5 or 6 people standing around that work there and noone has a clue when ticket office will be open , USELESS AND THEY STRIKE FOR MORE MONEY

items.title: I left my weekend bag on the Ashfield…
items.review_text: I left my weekend bag on the Ashfield train at 8.15pm on Monday evening when I got off the train at Bromley South train station.  I went to customer service on platform 1 to ask if they could retrieve it.  Sylvie in Customer Service Bromley South Station was amazing, she immediately rang train stations further down the line for someone to remove it and send it back up the line.  By 10.15 pm I had my bag back.  Sylvie was very helpful and reassured me she would do everything she could for me.  In the two hours I was waiting she kept me updated.  Thank you so much and to the staff who helped further down the line.  And to all the staff in Bromley South Station that night who helped me when I ran back into the station panicking after realising I had left my bag on the train.  Xx

items.title: AVOID
items.review_text: AVOID. 100members of useless staff! Always cancellations and strikes! Shame on you! Getting peoples money and never giving the services we are paying for!

items.title: Worst service ever

items.title: Not good

items.title: Good rail service :)
items.review_text: I booked my ticket on the southeastern app and then loaded it onto The Key ( southeastern travel card ). I had made it to my local station ( Greenhithe ). Tapped in and then made my way to the platform. it was good to see a mostly clean station with accessibility lifts on both platforms. After waiting for my train I boarded a fairly clean train and to my surprise, the heating was on. This made a good addition to my journey as it was freezing out. The train was in good condition with working toilets and priority seats. I had switched to Hither Green to continue my journey to Grove park. After a swift 45 minutes, I made it to my destination on time. I would give southeastern five stars but the reason I am giving it a four is that 2 different types of trains that I have been on had no toilets.

items.title: Impossible to get a ticket

No you receive a reference number and then have to go and collect a physical ticket. You look on google, apparently e-tickets are not the standard because these people live in the 1920s, it says download the app, you manage to download the app, you try to load your ticket and it doesn’t allow to obtain an e-ticket, you’re just left with a reference number. All of this is just very curious, these people have clearly decided the wrong career path or simply the wrong century. Hard to imagine this level of stupidity.

items.title: I pay over £7k for a season ticket.
items.review_text:
I pay over £7k for a season ticket.
This evening I was late for work again, and was interviewed in the office.
The 20:02 from Ramsgate was showing on time until about 20:08 when I was told it was cancelled. I could have caught the earlier train if they had informed us, I had no option other than catching the 20:20 train which arrives at St Pancras 50 minutes later than the 20:02.
The service is totally unreliable, it is stressful and upsetting constantly being late and I’m in danger of losing my job due to the incompetence of this train line. There is excuse after excuse, there aren’t many trains to manage, there is only one an hour on the fast line via Canterbury.
I was hoping the reliability would improve with the new timetable, but obviously not, i shouldn’t be the one facing a discipline meeting, it should be the incompetent signallers, and controllers working for Southeastern.

items.title: Appalling overcrowding on HS1 service
items.review_text:
On the 26th August I travelled from Stratford International (dep 12.19pm) to Canterbury West (arr 1.06pm). The train started from St Pancras International and I boarded the train in the front carriage.

I suffer from rheumatoid arthritis and find it very difficult to stand for any longer than about 5 minutes (my condition means that I sweat profusely when my body becomes stressed e.g. standing).

I have no problems with trains being highlighted as standing room only (although this is a surprise in the middle of the day, not so much surprise though when the train is only 6 carriages).

The real problems that I have are twofold:

1. that passengers are squeezed in like sardines (because of short trains) while there are so many 6 carriage sets sitting in the depot at Ashford doing absolutely nothing and which could be used to alleviate overcrowding on trains,

2. travelling on this route commands a premium fare. Yes, for some, a premium fare to stand-up for the entirety of their journey. 

Isn't it about time that carriage sets aren't left in the depot at Ashford (and maybe there are a few other sets elsewhere too) but are used to alleviate overcrowding that Southeastern are totally aware of and are able to predict?

items.title: Ridiculous service
items.review_text: Generally I'm all for workers and unions staging walk outs or /and going on strike, however my agreeing and supporting the NHS work force is one thing... Its something else when southeastern railway staff do it. OK, if they were already providing us, the public with a service comparable with the German service, for example, I too would be right behind their cause. However, the truth is that southeastern rail are completely abysmal. I was actually sat on the train ready to depart from the station and without warning a mumbled voice comes over the tannoy system to announce the train cancelled. The reason was the Charing Cross train, sat on the adjacent platform, didn't have a guard and clearly that train was more important than my one hence they took our guard off and put them on that one? Absolutely ridiculous. I'm currently on a 3 month probation at my new job so don't want to be late for work and yet in 4 weeks they've done it more times than I can remember. I paid £6.20 and when I claimed compensation was given £1.20 after nearly 2 weeks of waiting. The only reason I have given one star is because I can't give zero. Useless company, useless staff. Rant over.

items.title: SE will not make delay/repay claims to card registered with them to buy rail tickets
items.review_text:
I've now discovered why my delay/repay claims have been rejected.  Whilst Southeastern are perfectly prepared to register my MasterCard (supplied by one of the largest UK issuers) as my card to buy tickets, they will not refund to the card.  The app does not explain why the refund fails but on the website it told me the card type was unacceptable.  
{I'm normally travelling when requesting a rail ticket refund and using my smartphone; even if I start the application on the SE website it transfers me to the app to enter the details which it then rejects as incorrect.  Even if I'd known that SE won't refund to my mastercard, I'd only have the credit card used to purchase/collect the tickets with me.  Luckily today I was at home & used my laptop to apply and found an old Visa card in a drawer.  Now I'll have to use the Visa card for a purchase in order to benefit from the refund!  No way of knowing SE's motivation in rejecting valid refund applications.}

items.title: Southestern trains vs motorcycle
items.review_text:
The single fare from middle Kent to London for the rush hour times - £23.90    8-0
If they say that "advanced" tickets are available - yes they are, but for the times AFTER the rush hour, i.e. for trains arriving in London from 9:11AM and later. Who are these for ?
Return fare from London in the evening is £19.70. Ok, minus £8 if you have a Network Railcard.
And still morning trains are packed, with aircon unable to cool down and process the air and the COVID isn't that far still.
Then I need to pay my Tube fares on top. 
Summary: around £60 per day based on buying single tickets. Weekly? £130 per week. Monthly ? A whooping £501 !
Anyway just to compare the same trip on a motorbike:
Petrol-wise - around £8 return. Lets add £2 on top for all your TAX, MOT, Insurance. 
Tenner a day vs. £60. And no crowd. And no late trains (usual story) and cancellations. And no need to be at the station on time.
Southestern, you want more people on the train ? Lower your RIP-OFF prices and improve your service.

items.title: Rude and Confrontational Staff Member

I was met with rudeness, a confrontational attitude and a refusal to answer my question. This person appeared to have some issues and should not be in a customer facing role, especially as vulnerable people may be using the station, assuming that he was actually a member of the customer facing team. And if staff are now going to be moved out of ticket offices and onto platforms and station concourses, please consider vetting your staff before doing so, in the interests of your customers and the reputation of your company. Only suitable persons should be deployed.

items.title: TICKET REFUNDS
items.review_text:
Train cancelled by Southeastern! 
My brief London trip on 29 December to meet overseas family visiting London is now impossible - I haven't seen them for 3 years!
On top of causing massive disappointment, to obtain a refund, I am now forced to POST the tickets I had bought online and printed at the train station machine, AT MY EXPENSE, even though Southeastern is aware of the Royal Mail postal delays, backlogs, and lots of letters going missing.
In a digital age where everything is online, why can't the tickets just be made 'void', rather than inconvenience me further and add to environmental pollution, since I am now forced to DRIVE to a post office to get a stamp and post the letter? What an abysmal service!!!!
Will I ever see my money again? Not hopeful.
UPDATE: Received nonsensical copy-paste reply with wrong travel dates quoted, and refund declined as I'd bought an advance ticket. I'v just replied stating trip was NOT cancelled by me, so full refund is due. I will escalate to the Rail Ombudsman if next response is equally rubbish.
UPDATE #2: After 7 days of silence from the original idiot that rejected my request for a refund, I just received an email from another 'advisor' telling me that yes, I was correct about my entitlement to have the tickets refunded and that compensation is on its way.
Moral of the story: SOUTHEASTERN TRAINS WILL LIKELY REJECT YOUR CLAIM EVEN THOUGH IT'S VALID, PRESUMABLY BECAUSE MANY PEOPLE WOULD GIVE UP AT THAT STAGE, UNAWARE OF THEIR RIGHTS. IF YOU DO KNOW YOUR RIGHTS, HOWEVER, AND SOUTHEASTERN CANCELLED THE SERVICE YOU PRE-PAID, MAKE IT CLEAR, STAND YOUR GROUND, AND SOUTHEASTERN WILL PAY UP.

items.title: Seriously think twice
items.review_text:
Seriously think twice, and then twice again if you are thinking of moving to any location that relies solely on Southeastern rail, particularly if you need to commute regularly. The trains are late 9 times out of 10. If they are not late they are cancelled. Toilets are consitently disgusting. For the last 5 years where I live there have been no trains at weekends because of engineering works. The trains are often held for long periods between stations with no announcement or explanation from the driver. 

Plumstead is particularly bad for ticket inspectors who are there every month and are the most condescending rude people you will ever have the misfortune to meet. Moreover they cant explain why they keep targeting Plumstead (I know why). Also, staff at Plumstead stand smoking right in front of the station entrance billowing their dirty stinking smoke in the faces of people entering and leaving the station. Asking them for help at the service desk results in you being treated like an inconvenience. What a great representation of your company. Thank the heavens for the Elizabeth line which has enabled me to abandon this trash of a 'service' permanently.

Also, don't think you can just ruck up a couple of minutes early to catch your intended train. Oh no no no, you will be playing with fire - you need to catch the train before your intended one to make sure you get wherever you're going on time, and to make sure you dont miss your next connecting train.

If you have any real intention of regularly being on time please walk, cycle, take the bus or drive. If you have no other choice, my advice would be to catch the earlier train and use the southeastern website to keep track of late running and cancelled trains before you leave your house.
