items.title: Avoid staff at Tunbridge Wells!!! Awful
items.review_text:
Hello ,

I bought a return ticket to Tunbridge Wells at London Bridge

The machine only gave me 1 ticket. I did not realise that at the time though. 

When I arrived at Tunbridge Wells my ticket did not come back out of the machine as I expected. 

I called for assistance. The women took the ticket out of the machine and said just use it coming back as I also had proof of purchase online.

On return, I approached the staff who was not very helpful.  Told me I need to buy another ticket. I explained what her colleague had advised but she was adamant there was nothing she could do and told me to buy another ticket. 

I said I was about to miss my train and that I had work, she said she'd call the manager but when the manager arrived she looked at me and said sorry there's nothing we can do. All 4 members of staff were looking at me with some kind of disgust. 

Then a white guy come along with no ticket, the women just let him out. 

I missed my train and had to buy another ticket. 

When I got to London Bridge, my ticket didn't work, however the treatment I got at London Bridge was so much more empathetic. I explained what had happened in Tunbridge Wells and I was told I should have got their names because their treatment of me was unnecessary.

I still feel quite upset about the situation as those staff members had some kind of hate towards me. It can only be one reason because I'm a liked person with a loving friendly character. 

I'd like to know what will be done to prevent anyone else from experiencing this kind of ' customer care', as it has left a very bitter taste in my mouth.

items.title: SE claim violence assault on their trains is nothing to do with them
items.review_text:
My heavily pregnant sister was travelling when she asked a young man not to play music so loudly, and he responded by physically attacking her and kicking her in her stomach. The train guard was completely unsympathetic and refused to remove the violent thug, and wouldn't let my sister stay on to a stop that would be safe, but permitted the man to follow her off at her stop.

She was told that Southeastern would be investigating and reviewing the footage but when the police contacted them to request the footage Southeastern told them it had already been deleted.

When we phoned to make a complaint about how the situation had been handled, the customer services rep was very aggressive and hostile and just kept saying "that's nothing to do with us" and also said that my sister was "abusive" because she said "the man kicked the s**t out of me", called her hysterical, and threatened her. He refused to let her speak to a supervisor or give her any info on how to make a complaint.


Why on earth does Southeastern not care about and claim that violence on their trains is nothing to do with them and that they have no responsibility over it?

items.title: Smug kiosk attendant Canterbury East 0745 6.8.22
items.review_text:
Arrived a bit late but 4 minutes before train departure and an empty kiosk queue so no problem on a 2 platform station you'd think. WRONG.

The guy on the desk (picture available) decided he'd go as slow as he could. Train pulled up still about 2 minutes to go. So still ok? He even reassured us that there's be no problem. WRONG.

Handed tickets over EVENTUALLY. Now 30 seconds or thereabouts. So I ran up the steps and down the other side. I even got to the door with my hand outstretched - perhaps 2 or 3 inches from the button. 

Doors locked. No coincidence in the timings.

I walked back to the kiosk and there was our lovely public servant with a nice smug grin on his face at 0748 on the 6th August 2022. 

That's a person who should be in a business that has a public-facing side and all of that at a time when public support is beneficial for the pay rise he so richly deserves. WRONG!

items.title: Sat waiting for a delayed train at…
items.review_text: Sat waiting for a delayed train at pluckley for the 8:38 to London and it never turned up, no updates from anyone about what was going on, just left us on the platform wondering if we were going to work. Went in to the station and the official was sitting playing solitaire saying his PA system is broken. Why do we pay all this money for such crap service. Southeastern are the ultimate con artists, really don't care!

items.title: Worst experience ever..no toilets…
items.review_text: Worst experience ever..no toilets available..no internet..awful experience..avoid travelling with this company

items.title: Refunds for the Heatwave,
items.review_text: Mid July saw a heatwave that caused HUGE problems on the rails between Kings X & York with no travel either way on the East Coast Line on the 19th,as well as  being told "not to travel " to Kings X on the 20th due to work between Peterborough & Kings X.. I had to use 3 Paper tickets and after a lot of chew got  refunds from SE Trains after 14 days, The Twitter service I must say is excellent  for updates and replies are instant when there are disruptions on the line( many in mid July ! ) and a huge thumbs up to all behind the scenes. The HST trains are better than LNER in fact as regards comfort. Again many thanks to the SE team which must have been a nightmare for refunds ( then and now )for my unused tickets.

items.title: on 17th june
items.review_text:
on 17th june, i travelled on the high speed service from st pancras to margate during the heatwave that day. the train was packed until it's penultimate stop broadstairs. the legroom was still great! i'd say the high speed services are better than the low-budget victoria/charing cross "mainline" and "metro services" that i don't plan on doing anytime soon.

would i recommend the southeastern high speed service again? absolutely! just don't travel during a heatwave or when strikes take place

items.title: First and foremostly
items.review_text:
First and foremostly, I was instructed to go to a toilet on the platforms that was not available as it was locked at night time. I could not hold my bladder any more and had no choice but to relieve myself on the platform. As security wouldn’t provide any other option they then threatened to throw me
Off the station with no option to get home. The staff then refused to give me any of their names to make a formal complaint -about their abusive and homophonic behaviour. Absolute assailed no wonder southeastern lodge thier contact.

items.title: LACK OF REFUND
items.review_text: Went through the arduous process of claiming a refund from Southeastern for the industrial action in June, still not received any compensation. Not sure which is slower their trains or ability to refund passengers for no service.

items.title: Going on strike to ruin the first game…
items.review_text: Going on strike to ruin the first game of the football season won't be using train's ever again it's the people who you are pissing off your union can stick their heads where the sun don't shine

items.title: Seriously annoyed with this “service”…
items.review_text: Seriously annoyed with this “service” It’s generally pretty rubbish but the past month has just been ridiculous, trains constantly late or cancelled, short trains at peak times, train strikes, and then cancellations when the weather gets warm, constantly late to work constantly late home. The stations are filthy,  more so out the fronts which look like they need a good jet wash and steam clean, the trains are filthy. I’m mean I pay over £4000 a year for my ticket can you please tell me what I’m getting for that?  And who is in charge of this circus?

items.title: Disgusting unable to cope with…
items.review_text: Disgusting unable to cope with unexpected hot weather. When trains are  running have fewer carriages. No guard visible on train  to control the anti social behaviour of youths screaming shouting and playing. Unbelievable and not a cheap service fir very little in return

items.title: £72 pounds for two of peak overnight…
items.review_text: £72 pounds for two of peak overnight returns from battle to Charing x and they wonder why people don’t use trains or don’t pay  !!!!!!’

items.title: They are basically criminal
items.review_text:
They are basically criminal. Purchased tickets online, not online they force you to queue again at the station to 'print' the tickets (its 2022 use etickets.. ) but their station machines don't work properly so we had to go to the ticket office which forced us to buy another set of tickets. 

I would avoid like the plague if one could...

items.title: Totally USELESS ticket purchasing website
items.review_text: I’ve tried purchasing tickets via their website. TOTALLY USELESS! It’s failed at various stages after four attempts. I’ve seen other very bad reports about their ticket website, dating back to last year, BUT NOTHING seems to have been done to correct the problems. I’ve had to give this review one star just so I could write this. It deserves ZERO stars.

items.title: The worst transport company in London
items.review_text: They are almost always late and when they are not late, they leave earlier and people fail to get on the train.  They are never on time.  Their trains are old, terribly dirty and broken.  In the summer the heating in the carriages works and in the winter it does not.  The worst transport company in London. Such companies should not exist.

items.title: 5* Peter!
items.review_text:
Just wanted to share how polite, attentive and friendly Peter was at the Dover station this morning, we are currently on the train to charring cross, and even walking up and down checking tickets, his upbeat personality and service is fantastic 😊
What a lovely man! Never change bro!

items.title: Useless. Grubby trains
items.review_text: I had one SE train to catch today as crossrail is currently closed on Sundays.... it was cancelled because "the train crew was delayed" which we belive is code for the driver got laid on Saturday night and didn't show Sunday.

items.title: Delays Delays Delays
items.review_text: Well currently sitting on a train waiting for a driver to turn up..Wow can't believe you sell people tickets and don't even have a driver to run the train..Waiting time now approximately 30 mins absolutely rubbish service..Should be able to get a full refund in my opinion but will only get a tiny percentage back if I use the pay and delay not good enough...Really fed up with Southeastern tbh delay previous week coming back on a train via Tonbridge too!!! So wouldn't bother relying on getting anywhere on time that's for sure....

items.title: Scammers
items.review_text: Paid over £8k a year for a season ticket from Deal to London using HS1. Trains constantly delayed. Strike action over the summer - which means you don't get the full cost reimbursed. Total waste of money, get the car or work from home.

items.title: Racist recruitment
items.review_text: Racist recruitment, no senior management diversity or inclusion.

items.title: Not good enough.
items.review_text: Travelled from Skipton to Canterbury using Northern, LNER, Thameslink and Southeastern. We got to St Pancras without a problem only to find that our connection to Canterbury had been cancelled. No alternative offered - just wait an hour for the next one. Not good enough!

items.title: Crap
items.review_text: Crap. Complete crap. Thank goodness I only travel once a week. Not worth it. Old trains that are smelly and uncomfortable. The service is poor. I find it hilarious that they measure their delays by +30 mins…. Hiding the fact that they’re often late in the >15 min measure. It’s just not good enough. It’s a rip off.

items.title: Unbelievably unprofessional
items.review_text:
Unbelievably unprofessional, insensitive, and rude staff.
First time to Kent and first time took a SE train. The train was delayed at Ashford. I asked the staff member about alternative route, she answered： can't you just check the screen yourself?
Got back to Kings Cross. Ticket got swollen and the gate wouldn;t open. Got questioned by staff for 15 mins as if I was a thief. 
My first SE experience will hopefully be my last as well. Absolutely trash.

items.title: All local train so much late in south…
items.review_text: All local train so much late in south eastern line

items.title: One of England’s Best
items.review_text:
I use Southeastern every so often and every time I do I always come back shocked with amazement. Their service is kind of great and High Speed is an incredible experience being the fastest train in the UK besides the Eurostar.
The quality on almost all of their trains is great and comfy, I say ‘almost’ because the Class 465 is aging quickly and I’m not a big fan of it anyways. I guess Southeastern could improve some of their service on the routes down via Hastings and Canterbury East and also improve their toilets. Last time I traveled from St Pancras International to Canterbury West, it took only a bit over half an hour!
Southeastern’s drivers are very kind and sometimes train whistle at me, and the guards onboard have helped me several times.
I still need to travel on a CityBeam though, I’ll do that soon, but thank you Southeastern for getting me where I want to go at the speed of light, not just High Speed, Victoria, Cannon Street and Charing X trains are fast too! And Blackfriars I guess…

items.title: The most useless train company going
items.review_text: The most useless train company going,  no information as to what's happening,  end up travelling around the county two hours later than you want to be !!

items.title: Sack everyone who strikes
items.review_text:
Getting ready to strike whilst your service is absolutely shocking with trains just being canceled and leaving commuters in the stations and you want to get paid more ? Maybe deliver a service actually worth the pay rise. Anyone on strike should be sacked instantly seeing as there is so many unemployed people I'm sure we will fill all the well paid jobs you won't do you entitled bums. You do nothing but sit on your phone, point people in directions and get free travel. Then you want more pay, again deliver a service worth the pay rise.
Or at least protest like the Japanese do ie still rub the service but accept no money for tickets so that your corporate bosses suffer but not us the people who make it possible for you to get paid.

items.title: Travelled with my disabled niece on…
items.review_text: Travelled with my disabled niece on Saturday 21 May 2022 from Ashford to Stratford.  I cannot fault the service with regard to arranging ramps on the platforms to help my niece with her mobility scooter.  Nothing was too much of an effort.  What a wonderful service!  Thank you so much!

items.title: Absolutely useless company
items.review_text: Absolutely useless company. Be aware they don't stop at all train station at any time of the day. What's the point of a train station when they don't stop at it...

items.title: Positive but also advice
items.review_text: The staff on southeastern railway are lovely to talk to in the morning and when I have finished work knackered the only thing i would maybe make sure is where the box on the wall is where the tannoy and bell is kept to close and lock it before they walk away to check on the train don’t really want people playing with the buttons and that person in charge of the train at that time to get into trouble

items.title: Worst service I've ever had anywhere in 41 years
items.review_text:
If you enjoy being argued with and sworn at by ticket office staff, (despite clear signs saying I would be prosecuted for doing just that to staff), having tickets thrown back at you through the window and told to get out for nothing more than the staff member not wanting to get off his seat to check the machine like you are some kind of savage animal, being refused a refund for a ticket you clearly didn't use in the 5 minutes from purchasing and having the company prolong the process and the complaint being played down and discouraged....
St Leonards warrior square and southeastern is the network to use
Totally shambolic and their only concern is how to get as much of your money as possible and customer service is a suggestion, not a priority
How this company is allowed to trade is incredible

items.title: I had a change of plans today
items.review_text:
I had a change of plans today - my father had a heart attack and I needed to get home quickly.I didn’t have a ticket for the high speed -  The guard at the station waived me straight through to catch the next train and said I could speak with the train manager about upgrading my ticket. 
Mark, the manager on the high speed was extremely empathetic and did all he could to help, what a great guy! Thank you to you Mark and the gentleman at the station (sorry I didn’t catch your name). 
Best wishes 
Chris

items.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
items.review_text: Train tickets for journeys from London to SE England are SO EXPENSIVE it should be prohibited!!! £80 for a day ticket return from London to Folkestone is ludicrous! It is hard to reduce carbon footprint with astronomical prices like this. Better off driving!!

items.title: Polite staff but disappointing trains 🚊
items.review_text: Pretty good trains company. Very freindly staff and excellent high speed services. But stations and trains are very poor and and are outdated AND grubby.

items.title: Poor
items.review_text:
Came back from holiday used DLR, which is grubby to say the least. Got to Woolwich Arsenal and the toilets were shut at 8pm.
Terrible service and everything is dirty.
It would be shut down if elsewhere in Europe.

items.title: I am not quite surprised they were…
items.review_text: I am not quite surprised they were rated poor this year .  The carriage are pathetic and are very very low quality standards . The charges they take is as per any standard service but the quality they deliver on trains and passengers is zero .

items.title: No good thing
items.review_text:
I know some people that work for this company so I will be more specific as those I know in the company are not to blame.
Although trains are cancelled few and far between for me, I can always rely on a delay near enough everyday. 

There are not always toilets on these trains and if you are lucky enough to be on a train with a toilet then I recommend you bring your own toilet roll as that's also hard to come by.

If your train is delayed and or cancelled southeastern has not made it the easiest thing to claim your money back it can especially be hard for the elderly. 

They have made it so hard that even I don't bother and say they can keep my money.

It's a shame but I can't really think of a good thing to say about southeastern railway

items.title: Was at London Bridge Station asking…
items.review_text: Was at London Bridge Station asking Yina for information. What a very friendly, polite, informative and diplomatic person, she absolutely made it more then a good experience passing through London Bridge. For those who don’t know, London Bridge Station have a very good work force and an unique culture all together, thank you much well appreciated I love it more and more travelling through your station. Well done Yina you make us feel more confident travelling knowing that on the station there are people knowing where we should go when lost.

items.title: ATTITUDE for asking a question
items.review_text:
If you can avoid South Eastern Railway do so. They are now employing people who give ATTITUDE to customers who ask questions.  

I put my experience to being White, English and after I paid.

London to Faversham (single) £30.30 Train Fare

London to Faversham (single) £7.00 Coach Fare

items.title: On time going there and back always ask…
items.review_text: On time going there and back always ask ticket office before traveling if there s any disruption on your journey all good no traffic .

items.title: This ‘service’ is an absolute disgrace.
items.review_text:
This ‘service’ is an absolute disgrace. You can compute for a week before finding a train which runs on time. The company hid £25 million of public money last year and have now ‘lost’ that money. This should have been properly investigated and not covered over. 

Services are cancelled if bad weather is speculated, even if that bad weather never comes the drivers have already been given the day off. Services are cancelled due to ‘insufficient’ staff. Staff at stations make no effort to keep customers informed or help them. SE railway’s default position is to cancel services as soon as they can. It is nothing more than pure laziness and incompetence. Be better.

items.title: Racist act by the staff
items.review_text: We were travelling in group. 4 of my friends went inside the train but I wasn't allowed to go inside the train as the lady said I was late by a second. She told me I have to take another train.

items.title: What a diabolical service
items.review_text:
What a diabolical service. The HS1, often late, terminates, when late, at an earlier station leaving the passengers to wait for the next train. This has happened countless times on my commute. There is never an explanation so it's  one star for communication as well.

Update: If I could give no stars I would. Today the service terminated (again) in Ramsgate. I, unfortunately, had my earphones in. The next thing I know, I'm returning to Canterbury. Nobody came through the carriages. So, is it now a liability to listen to your music on Southeastern trains lest they make an announcement? When I asked the guard what was going on, he was surly, rude, and tried to blame me with words to the effect that it was my responsibility. When I questioned this assumption and suggested that (im)proper staffing levels might be responsible, he tried to get support from other passengers. So, in effect, he tried to gather his army to raise up against me. Needless to say, nobody responded because in their hearts they know the ugly truth. Southeastern is, indeed, diabolical (in the true meaning of the word; 'diabolus' / devil).

Update: 13.04.22. Again, the service from Canterbury West was delayed and rather continue to its intended destination, Margate, it terminated in Ramsgate. This left all of the passengers to hot foot it to the Victoria service  which was sardine like. The carriage clearly hadn't been cleaned and stunk of vomit. Not wanting to catch Covid or endure the smell of vomit, I took the bus. The train pain continues.

items.title: Expensive with zero service
items.review_text: Hi Southeastern highspeed, If you are charging customers £30+ for day ticket please have sufficient staff and make sure all ticket dispensing machines are working. 3 machines in busy station with one or two working at any point with massive queues. Staffed ticket point mostly closed than open! Terrible customer service!!

items.title: Thank you
items.review_text: I cannot thank southeastern railways enough for ensuring that myself and my disabled daughter got home even though the trains were cancelled because of storm Eunice.  We travelled to London the day before the storm hit and at that point I was already impressed with the help and support we received from the staff, then today as soon as I spoke to a member of staff to ask for advice on what to do to get home they ordered a taxi.  Thank you for helping us so efficiently.

items.title: 5 star for accessibility!
items.review_text: I am a disabled passenger and in light of the disruptions to my journey home from London Victoria to West Malling due to Storm Eunice the staff at Victoria immediately ordered me a taxi for which they payed and got me home safely as soon as they could. I personally couldn't have asked for a better response to the situation.

items.title: Disrespect
items.review_text: It matters not how many times one complains about the people who put their dirty feet on the seats. South Eastern reply with waffle that something is being done. They were quick enough to put up signs stating you will be fined up to £6,500 for not wearing a mask but still nothing regarding dirty people who plaster the seats with dirt. It is accepted by all train companies . It has festerd for too long and they don't have the balls to stop it.

items.title: Train stuff do not keep safe distance
items.review_text: Train stuff do not keeping safe distance, train Sr pancras int

items.title: Overpriced and Overvalued
items.review_text:
I can get a train from London Kings Cross to Leeds for less money than I pay on a 30 minute… that’s how overpriced they are and then their staff are rude, Arrogant and unaccommodating, asking them for help most of the time feels like a chore and when a train is cancelled or doesn’t run properly (IE every other day) they have 0 sympathy and are more content with trying to “Defend the train line” than they are with helping you. 

I’m literally moving out of Kent to get away from it because my Train fares cost more than my rent and I can’t live like this anymore.

items.title: Useless staff wearing southeastern…
items.review_text:
Useless staff wearing southeastern uniforms at Waterloo Station standing there gossiping then slow to respond... And when you ask them a question they look at you as though to say 'why did you interrupt my flow'! 
They then look on National Rail Enquiries (online which I just did hence asked them which platform)... By the time they tell me, the train pulls out so you have to wait ages for the  next one which is a slow service. Arrgggggh! Rubbish.

items.title: Wye station staff. 7th Jan.
items.review_text: On the 7th of  January I purchased tickets for a return London trip for the following week. The young lady in the Wye ticket office was a total joy, she explained my options, and went to great lengths to ensure I had as much information as possible, even giving me a printout of my viable journeys. Her smile was radiant and so cheered up my day. It is not often that I bother to comment on service but this young lady is a total credit to South eastern. I  do not remember her name but hope that my review will reach the ears of her overseers. Thanks,Allen Twyman.

items.title: Staff on 23rd December
items.review_text: I was travelling from Headcorn to Charing Cross on Thursday 23rd December and a member of staff (called Mark), was really friendly, helpful and really went out of his way to help and just be himself. Thank you.

items.title: Sittingbourne station
items.review_text: Wow. Beyond rude. 21.12.21 7.30am. Older man wearing an Xmas jumper. I asked if he wanted to put the ticket on to a “The Key” card,” I don’t know what that is!”( I’m clearly showing it to him). Spoke to me with uninterest, as if I’m an idiot!. If this is someone who is customer service front faced I would be worried. I’m truly sorry your job is a burden to you.

items.title: A company which misrepresents the…
items.review_text: A company which misrepresents the meaning of the following words Service, Value, Punctuality, Honest, Cleanliness and Organised. Whoever thinks they are running this circus is not a chairman, or the like, but a clown.

items.title: Expensive, terrible value, rude and unhelpful staff!
items.review_text: This has to be the most expensive, mainline commuter service in the country. First of all, you need a railcard and clunky Key card to upload any season tickets. The staff will not accept an email as proof of ticket. I found this out at my peril when the ticket office and ticket machine were out of order at Margate. I got issues with a fixed penalty notice when I arrived at St Pancras as I did not have a ticket, although had confirmation of payment. This payment also came in at £750 for the privilege of using a ‘high speed’ service. The whole operation is an absolute farce!

items.title: Just walk
items.review_text: It almost feels like the there is a hidden bonus pay for staff if the trains run late. I have not had a single train arrive on time this year. Whoever is running this company needs to be fired.

items.title: Poorly run rail services
items.review_text: Poorly run rail services. Most of the staff model their behaviour on Eastenders cockney characters. They cancel trains at the drop of a hat and the refund service is hit and miss.

items.title: Discriminatory
items.review_text: Failing to announce that exemptions apply to the face covering mandate on public transport, which is discriminatory and could cause hate crime towards people with hidden disabilities. So unprofessional.

items.title: Always late, not an exaggeration
items.review_text: Hard to recall in recent memory, don't think I have ever got a South Eastern train that's on time. Literally every train journey in past two years that I've been on is late.

items.title: Late to work everyday.
items.review_text:
£535 for a train ticket and I have been late to work everyday this week due to trains being terminated at random stations nowhere near my destination.
Worst part is I get the first available train of the day. 
Make the railways public again.

items.title: Dreadful company
items.review_text: Dreadful company, trains always late/delayed, connections always missed, arrogant untouchable staff, toilets always closed. Appalling, awful company.

items.title: Thank you for taking such good care.
items.review_text: My mother travelled between Tonbridge and Battle, she has had a great deal of challenging issues to deal with and was distressed when arriving at Tonbridge; staff took total care of her, getting her safely on the train ensuring she was ok. They called through to Battle where a lady was waiting on the platform for her to ensure she was ok. I was waiting for her and to see how much care was given has blown me away! I cannot thank those members of staff enough. Thank you

items.title: Just a short thank you to Southern rail…
items.review_text:
Just a short thank you to Southern rail staff who went above and beyond to reunite me with me ruck sack having stupidly left it on an Ebbsfleet to St Pancreas service early today.
I would particularly like to thank Sam at St Pancras, Ross at Reigate and the on train manager of the train back to St Pancras at 14:21.
All helped to track down and return my bag, thank you so much.

items.title: Good on a whole, but fell short in 2019...
items.review_text: On the whole, I have had no issues with Southeastern Railway except for one time in June of 2019. On that occasion, we went to London via Southern Railway for a concert at Wembley. We didn't make the last train back from Victoria as it had been cancelled. so we had to catch one via a Southeastern train in order to get the last one from their service to get home. We didn't make it and got as far as Tunbridge Wells. This is when things took a turn. We, my family and 2 other people, we're told that we couldn't wait for the first train in the station and had to wait outside. The staff at the station locked it up and went home having ditched 5 customers outside to stay the night on a bench nearby. Not to mention it was a Saturday and kicking out time, with drunken people staggering in the street and shouting antisemitic slurs. After a night on the street in Tunbridge Wells, we learned that a bus replacement service was running so at some time around 6 in the morning, we were finally able to leave and go home. When I raised this point with Southeastern's customer service on Twitter and then directly on their website. they were initially very helpful and issued a refund. They asked that I took a photo of the tickets and I also added the document from Southern Railway giving us permission to travel on the line at no extra cost. I submitted the information to Southeastern that they required and then silence. I contacted them again and again and they never responded and I never got the refund. They have a duty of care to make sure their customers can get home if their train service fails to do so. Yet this one time, we were left on the streets and made to fend for ourselves until the next day.

items.title: Embarrassing- avoid
items.review_text: A journey which used to take 60 minutes now takes 150, because there are no longer any direct trains to the coast. There is now a need to change at Ashford with extended delays. As for travel on Sundays, forget it. It is disappointing at the very least to see the deterioration of this service.   It has descended to an embarrassment, and I recommend avoiding using it wherever possible.

items.title: YOU SHOULD BE INVESTIGATED! BUNCH OF THIEVES
items.review_text:
IF I COULD GIVE YOU -10 I WOULD. BLOODY TERRIBLE SERVICE, TRAINS NEVER ARE ON TIME, THE REFUND PROCESS IS BUILT IN SUCH A WAY THAT YOU WILL GIVE ME AFTER A FEW MINUTES. I TRAVEL ON DIFFERENT TRAINS AT DIFFERENT TIMES ON DIFFERENT DAYS AND ITS ALWAYS THE SAME. HOW ARE TRAINS DELAYED WHEN THEY ROOT BEFIN FROM THAT SAME STATION?? TOTALLY ALL OVER THE PLACE. ONE TIME YOU DECIDE TO OPERATE ON TIME, YOUR TRAINS DEPART BEFORE THE ACTUAL TIME. ALL YOU EVER HEAR IS SORRY. 
I WILL START PAYING FOR MY TRAVEL WITH A SORRY. STUPID COMPANY. YOU SHOULD BE BURNED DOWN.

items.title: Absolutely dreadful
items.review_text:
How on earth does this company operate....

Trains are delayed or cancelled so frequently that it genuinely leaves you wondering how this line functions.

The poor service makes commuting an absolute nightmare and always puts you in the embarrassing situation of turning up to meetings late / never quite knowing if you are going to be able to get in at all!

I very rarely leave reviews about companies or services, but Christ... this service is beyond a joke and completely inadequate. 

The one glimmer of positivity goes to the CS team who are very polite and understanding and are mostly quick to issue compensation or refunds. I feel sorry for you guys!!

items.title: I lost my credit card at Charing Cross…
items.review_text:
I lost my credit card at Charing Cross station at 20.00 on 20th October. At 7.21the following morning, I received an email from Sandra, Team Leader, who had tracked down my email address, to say that the card had been found and was awaiting collection by me.
I consider that to be absolutely the best possible service, and i am very grateful to her and all involved for their highly effective and professional response.

items.title: Completely UNRELIABLE
items.review_text: Completely UNRELIABLE. Late trains on a DAILY basis, always the same excuses of signal problems or train faults. This is the worst train company I know. And they put ticket prices up!! They should lose their contract,they are an absolutely useless company

items.title: Pathetic
items.review_text: Such a useless Railway. I am sitting here in the rail station Ashford as my train left. I wasted my time trying to get through the barrier using 'The Key'. There was a person at the international station side of the barrier yesterday but none today. I need to wait here atleast 30 minutes for the next train, which is already showing 3 minutes delay. Yesterday I spent 15 minutes on the platform as the 6:59 Charing Cross Train was delayed; no one apologised. I am 50 plus and many times I was running to catch the train and experienced cardiac arrest like feeling many times. Now I need to switch back to my car (to increase the Carbon Footprint) because of the rubbish service being provided by Southeastern. A humble request, please spare your employees (do not stress them too much). Try to find the ways to improve your service by using your brain. Thank you. Bye. See you Later.

items.title: Apart from terrible prices and…
items.review_text: Apart from terrible prices and punctuality, I could never understand why I can’t get on a later train to the same destination which is the exact same price without having to pay an administration fee. Another company that takes advantage of customers. Hopefully TfL takes control.

items.title: Atrocious
items.review_text: Horrible. I'm speechless. The trains aren't fresh.

items.title: SE Railways - No accountability and don’t care
items.review_text:
Got the 5.46 from Bekesbourne to Dover to catch a connection with 10 mins to spare.  Train late by 5 mins at local station and then arrived at Dover even later. Missed connection. How can a train be so late so early in the morning?
No announcement, no apologies, nothing. A don’t care, no accountability business.

items.title: Best conductor
items.review_text: I’ve been getting the Train to school for five years with minimal issues, although last night I got the best train with the most brilliant conductor. I believe his name was Ashley but he cheered everybody up on a dreary Thursday evening. Absolutely brilliant reminders me of holidays! This man deserves a pay raise

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text:
Rail replacement bus service.
No indication of this during booking.
Miserable station staff bawling at members of the public for parking outside the station... despite there being no signage to tell them not to.
Crammed onto a coach with not enough seats.
Another coach driver instructed our driver to turn back because another party had been waiting "for f**king hours".
Arrived with barely enough time to make the next connecting train, having to sprint from the car park to the train.

Clowns.

How such a vital service is able to continually waste people’s time and mess up their plans, day in, day out, remains a mystery. Answers on a postcard pleas. Help with this?

An absolutely horrible company with rude staff. Southeastern have demonstrated the lack of importance they attach to customers, trains are now regularly leaving 59 seconds earlier than scheduled so they can achieve their punctuality targets, this is unhelpful to customers and misleading. You are ‘catching out’ many passengers resulting in them being left on platforms! Staff are also inconsiderate and rude.

W@nkers

They provided a ramp for easy access onto the train, and radioed ahead to staff at our destination telling them which carriage we were in, and there was a staff member standing on the platform with the ramp ready for us to alight the train. Well done Southeastern! Look forward to travelling with you again.

Unbelievably useless, money-grubbing organisation. How is it possible to he consistently late and always screw your passengers as comprehensively as this ludicrous organisation?

No-one in their right mind chooses to travel with Southeastern but they have the monopoly here so we have no choice!

I would have given no stars tbh, the service is shift asf! 
2 trains already being cancelled and then rest are delayed. Try to fix this because unlike you we have timelines.

But now all of a sudden I can't, and the help services are absolutely useless! have been going round and round between southeastern railway, network railcard and national rail. This is an absolute joke!

items.title: The most unreliable service I ever had…
items.review_text: The most unreliable service I ever had to use and I'm from Hungary.

items.title: Complete failure of a company
items.review_text:
First day back at the office after 18 blissful months of not having to go near the dreadful Southeastern trains and guess what?
Train stopped at Tonbridge on the way home. Left sitting for ages having been told we were waiting for a change in driver. After nearly half an hour told train is cancelled because now there was a tree on the line.
Had to find another way home. Over 3 hours from office to home.
What an awful (but very typical) welcome back from Southeastern Railway! 
What will they throw at us next time I wonder?

I have been late for work, lessons and have been in serious trouble because of these people! Fix your company and staff please!!!! This have been going for years! items.title: Not run for passengers

Trains in a poor state, only occasionally have toilets, awful timetable and predominantly going into Cannon Street which is no use to man nor beast.  I can only assume that offering a consistent service into a useful station such as Charing Cross costs Southeastern more money which isn't good for those shareholders!

items.title: Clapped trainline
items.review_text: Clapped trainline, missed train after a 30 second stop where the conductor didn't allow us to get on, sought yourselfs out. Now stuck on the side of a railway for an extra hour and dont have the money to buy another ticket, don't waste your time with this awful trainline

items.title: Actually not too bad, but expensive
items.review_text:
I actually think this service is great, and I enjoy stepping on their trains. 

But I won’t give you a high score until you bring the prices down. You, and all other privatised rails across the U.K., have been ripping off customers for far too long.

I can’t wait for Great British Railways to bring this company down a peg or two.

items.title: Trains always late and missing my…
items.review_text: Trains always late and missing my connection. Awful service and very overpriced.

items.title: Absolutely

items.title: This has to be the worst out of all…
items.review_text:
This has to be the worst out of all train companies in the UK. I bought a ticket to go to Dover, for (already a very expensive price) £35, then was double charged for £70 on the way back into London, whilst i still have the receipt for the full ticket payment on my phone.

items.title: Should be illegal
items.review_text: Like many others, if I could give it a 0 I would. Horrendous service, trains always late, which for someone like myself who catches a connecting train  means I am left waiting for another connecting service for at least 40 minutes. Considering most of us using this service travel at least an hour, no charging points on the non-fast service. Ridiculously over priced tickets, especially for such a poor train line.

items.title: Incredibly bad
items.review_text: Incredibly expensive and truly a pathetic business

items.title: I bunk the train to everywhere from…
items.review_text: I bunk the train to everywhere from everywhere multiple times a day Alfriston have started hiring people to stand outside and check tickets so now and then I don’t bank with train but south-easter don’t gain any money because I just walk home or walk to where ever I need to go instead And the next day went there is no ticket member I bank it again so in fact they’re actually losing money by paying for three people to stand there checking tickets paying their wages probably £9 an hour for three people for 12 hours and yet every person who didn’t have a ticket and was going to dump the train is Bunkie because they don’t have the money to buy a ticket either way the people that they turned away don’t buy a ticket and may just walk or get a bus to where ever they need to go so south-eastern I’m trying to save money by stopping people using the trains for free and instead they’re losing money because every person still doesn’t buy a Ticket because they were bunking in the first place because I can’t afford one so they’re losing money paying these divs ts £9 an hour losing about £300 a day I’m not saving anything what a waste of time and what idiot thought to put member to just waste south-eastern is money

items.title: Absolute shambles
items.review_text: Absolute shambles. Both my outgoing and return trains cancelled today meaning missed meetings both sides of my travel. Even when there are no passengers they can’t manage to run trains. Country tries to get back to business after COVID -  shame we can’t rely on this joke of a service.

items.title: Travelling alone when it’s dark and…
items.review_text:
Travelling alone when it’s dark and late is unfortunately something I dread as a woman. 
Last night (03/03/2021) I was waiting for my connection train at Ashford International and there weren’t many people around. I could see a guy who had clearly been drinking and still had a couple of cans with him further up the platform. After a couple of minutes he approached me and I instantly felt a little nervous and vulnerable. He was asking questions about me and trying to give me his phone number. He left after a couple of attempts and me not giving much back. I was almost immediately approached by two members of staff at the station who asked me if I was okay and what the guy had said to me. 
I instantly felt relieved and safe. They were obviously watching and aware of the safety of anyone at the station at this point and acted almost instantly. 
They checked with me a good few times that I really was okay then they stayed nearby until I was on my train. 
The kindness almost brought a tear to my eye so I just wanted to say a massive thank you.

items.title: If I could give Southeastern a lower…
items.review_text: If I could give Southeastern a lower score it would be 0. Train that never run to time  staff who are just dim witted or just plain unhelpfull. A shambollick terrible service who don't care about the public just care about profit

items.title: Dire Southeastern Service as ever
items.review_text: 2 inches of snow and they run their winter timetable, which basically means the service is slashed. A total management restructure is needed and out all those making these decisions out on the platforms so as they can see what they are doing.

items.title: Always a happy ride
items.review_text: There are always friendly staff at the stations, more than happy to help passengers.

items.review_text: Totally useless train service. Cancelled trains with no prior notice, literally cancelled right before departure time.  Healthcare worker trying to get home to Rochester

items.review_text: Unbelievable how much they charge for such a poor service! I don’t think I’ve ever got on a train that was on time! If there were any other option then I’d obviously change.

items.title: I’ve been using southern train line for…
items.review_text:
I’ve been using southern train line for the past 4 years. However, today I met Eric he was so helpful and friendly . Plus because it was the latest train and it delayed and I was so tired he always checked up ! 
Thanks Eric!

items.title: Had to share this due to concerns…
items.review_text: Had to share this due to concerns around the pandemic - had to go to the City for business , I really tried to stay away throughout for obvious reasons, on the way home 4.30ish heading back home a cleaner entered to the train at London Bridge - gloves, plastic head cover etc and what looked like a damp brown dirty dish rag (truly was dirty looking) no cleaning products no team of others with hospital grade cleaning products? One bloke walked and smeared this dirty rag on everything you might touch from one end of the train to the other!?! Beware - these trains are likely breeding grounds for the Covid - i wont be using them again full stop as Southeastern are clearly filthy people who do not care about safety!

items.title: I’d hardly call Southeastern a service
items.review_text: I’d hardly call Southeastern a service, when they can’t even fulfil their duty of actually turning up ON TIME. Everyday this week I have been late to college because of this poor service that turns up over 10 minutes late everyday because of some rubbish excuse. They change the excuse everyday. I can list them: faulty line, train broke down, speed restriction etc. STOP EXCUSING YOUR POOR SERVICE. But yeah I’d really recommend an hourly, not frequent but hourly service that never turns up on time. Really good if you want to turn up to somewhere LATE. A joke.

items.title: Living hell
items.review_text: Trains either get cancelled, late, or went to a different platform, without announcing in the screens or audio announcement. Ultimately and unbelievably poor, catastrophic service. Cannot be called service, even.

items.title: Southeastern railways is a joke
items.review_text: Fell asleep on the train and woke up as we were leaving my stop. Got off at the next stop got stopped for not having a valid ticket. Explained the situation and was given a £76 penalty fare. Then went through a an unsuccessful appeal process. The private train industry is a joke. TLDR: £76 Fine for getting off at 1 stop late for dozing off

items.title: Unhelpful from King Cross
items.review_text: Unhelpful from King Cross, the staff was annoyed and rude.

items.title: Actually a good train line!
items.review_text: You know what despite some bad feedback on here I actually really like southeastern, they rarely have train disputation IE:works on the Trainline and when they do they give you plenty of notice and make it clear.....by putting up posters at stations, all over Twitter and other social media so you have enough time to make other arrangements. I have found that when something happens like signal fault or someone on the tracks they are quick to resolve the problem and bring service back to normal......I use south south eastern everyday to get to and from work at peak and non peak hours including really early trains and late trains and I rarely have problems with them. Compared to other train networks like great northern and southern that are absolutely shambolic with daily delays, daily issues on the train lines, cancelled trains last minute I actually can’t fault southeastern.  For people complaining about timetables if your a frequent southeastern customer you should know by now they change to summer and autumn time tables and should be checking before you travel train times to avoid issues and give yourself enough time to get to the station and wait! It’s abit of common sense, throughout covid trains were still running at a reasonable service not as frequent As I would like but frequent enough and for people like me that are key workers working throughout covid this was excellent and a life saver, saving me from tubing and getting several busses, I just checked trains before I travel and made sure I knew the train times. I have been travelling on south eastern for around 5 years now and genuinely can not fault the company compared to other appalling ones I’ve experienced.

items.title: Absolutely horrible…
items.review_text:
SE have always been unreliable operator incapable of running normal services,but now they went even further. As of 7th of September they introduced a new timetable,which they claim would run 98% of pre-COVID trains. This is an absolute lie and they know it. In reality they have cut 50% of rush hour trains from my station (Chelsfield),removed all fast services and left only one direct to Charing Cross. They make us do multiple changes of stations and trains ,exposing us to COVID at a greater rate. 
Their replies are pointless and you can clearly feel they are just annoyed and want you to disappear. 
Obviously there is no alternative and we have to use this horrible company which makes it even more frustrating

items.title: John @Sevenoaks Station
items.review_text: We were looking to have a partial refund for a train ticket after wrongly being charged for an adult price despite it being for a child. John at the ticket office of Sevenoaks station was rude, unfriendly and took over 10 minutes to complete the task leaving us annoyed and dissatisfied with the service!!

items.title: I Booked the tickets but i can’t go…
items.review_text: I Booked the tickets but i can’t go because of the gov.uk keep changing  the corridor countries  that need to quarantine after coming back from France. I emailed the train customer service with so little hope that I can change the date of tickets as I purchased the non changable ticks. I received the reply on the same date and was offered the refund. After I replied back that I want to get the refund. I received the confirmation of the refund straight away. The email was written so politely. I am very pleased and would recommend if you have a problem, try to contact them. I went to their website and fill in the contact us form with few screens shot of my tickets and the evidences why i cannot travel.

items.title: Always reliable and helpful
items.review_text: Trains always on time these days, trains much cleaner than they used to be and information about delays or disruption much more publicised. So glad TFL don't run this service, there are actual ticket offices and staff that can help you at most stations, something TFL got rid of at underground stations.

items.title: Can’t praise the rail staff enough
items.review_text: My mobility isn’t good and staff at Dover Priory; Ashford International and London Bridge stations went out of their way to make my journey easy and pleasant when attending Guy’s hospital recently on 7th Aug. I thank them all so much

items.title: Great Staff
items.review_text:
Just wanted to come on here and say Phillip who assists at Stratford International is an exceptionally wonderful man!

I had one of the worst days ever and he went above and beyond to help me. 

You are extremely lucky to have him!

items.title: Unreliable, greedy and overall poor excuse of a railway operator
items.review_text:
I have been forced to use Southeastern Railway for years had have nearly nothing positive to say. 

They know that commuters rely on their service so hike the prices up but can't even provide a decent service.

The only reliable thing about southeastern is that you know your train will either be late or cancelled without any notice.

To top it off, if you dare ask for compensation they will offer peanuts in return. For example, i paid about 25 quid for a return from London to Rochester, the last couple trains were cancelled so we were unable to get home. Had to stay at a friend's house and pay for another ticket the next day so already out of pocket. How much compensation did i get? About 5 pounds.

They don't care about their passengers and are useless. Needs to be handed back to the government, these private companies are a disgrace to treat the British public this way.

items.title: Staff and passenger safety during Covid-19 crisis.
items.review_text: I think it is outrageous how your own website states that we as customers should be wearing face coverings on your transport systems. However- none of your staff are? Upon mentioning this to one of the station staff, they told me that Southeastern are refusing to let their staff wear face masks or coverings. Clearly you do not value your staffs safety nor any of your customers. This needs to be reviewed to keep both your own staff and customers safe ASAP

items.title: I feel compelled to write a review…
items.review_text: I feel compelled to write a review regards the Customer Service team at South Eastern who have been fantastic. Due to the current COVID-19 I have been waiting an annual season ticket refund. I spoke with 3 x separate advisors who were incredibly sympathetic, patient and thorough. A credit to the organisation in the current climate - thank you!

items.title: Take you money quickly, but seem to be unable to refund you - AVOID
items.review_text: Take you money quickly, but seem to be unable to refund you - AVOID

items.title: Does what it's supposed to do, and staff always great. No real complaints!
items.review_text: Travel every day (before the pandemic!) and always get a seat on rush hour trains to / from London. Generally comfy and clean, and reasonably on time. Travel a lot at weekends to other parts of Kent and always good at the weekends. Staff usually friendly and helpful. Delay Repay paid really quick when I apply. Would like to see more done about the fare dodgers who I see on the trains at weekends though!

items.title: Train cancelled last minute, picking on disabled
items.review_text:
Train cancelled last minute , I have a disabled pass for my disability and been trying to get a refund for my tickets from the 7th of march keeps getting rejected. Tried to get a refund at the station apparently you have to be charged a £10 admin charge..... Right. So I have to do it online but can't as you don't give refunds to people.

Edit : Southeastern got back to me and gave me 80p for my £5.70 ticket.....Criminals and pisstakers

items.title: No functioning toilet
items.review_text: How can a train lack a functioning toilet it's like a basic human amenity. I'm on the train and want to pee the toilet doesn't flush, dirty and overflowing with urine. Disappointing to say the least.

items.title: I was delayed 63 minutes on the train…
items.review_text: I was delayed 63 minutes on the train down to Birchington on Thursday 5th March. I applied on line to receive the full refund, only to turned down because I didn't put in the correct ticket number! First of all the online form for claiming a refund has got errors and when I called to try to claim it, they didn't accept the proof I gave them of my credit card receipt! They are a company with little intelligence, and couldn't even honour a £10.10 refund! In future I will be driving!

items.title: SE Trains excel at incompetence
items.review_text: SE Trains excel once again - at being useless. Thrown of a train in the pouring rain to fend for ourselves. No staff to direct us to nearest bus stops. Arrived at Lewisham to more chaos, indifferent demoralised  staff - no management to be seen, which is typical. Do they have any management staff that are brave enough to face the public? No information, no empathy, humanity or sign that they cared a jot about the situation. Shame on you and please someone, anyone get rid of this incompetent organisation. 3 hours to get from Victoria to Dartford.

items.title: I understand when the weather will…
items.review_text: I understand when the weather will delay trains which is out of your hands, far too often trains are delayed because you are waiting for a member of staff, seriously!!!!

items.title: Southeastern railway services are oblivious to problems no doubt
items.review_text: Southeastern railway services are appalling considering the amount you pay for the service. Trains are not cheap it’s just as expensive to run a car with what luxuries? You don’t get to places on time, trains bloody stink and filthy, no staff on platforms especially places like Slade green and Erith which makes it harder for people that don’t know how the system works and not to mention, when there is a delay you know 30+ minutes later and you’re already late. When you’ve paid £300 a month for a season ticket to be late every other day it’s frustrating & annoying.

items.title: New week
items.review_text: New week, no change. Stuck outside London Bridge and the train arrived and left a minute early from the destination. South Eastern get worse and worse as the weeks go on, as stated by many on here the worst Trainline in the country. Please remove this railway from under private control, it is a shambles.

items.title: Worst train company ever.
items.review_text: The Southeastern trains from/to Dartford and Slade Green are absolutely disgusting. The trains are filthy from inside, the arrangement of the seats is uncomfortable, the seats are dirty and it doesn't look like the trains are ever cleaned. Frequently there is awful smell coming from the toilet. The trains are rarely on time, delay repay takes forever to process and is very little in comparison to the inconvenience caused from the delays. Some trains arrive with 6-8 coaches in peak times, which is not enough to accommodate the amount of people who need to get to work/home. The ventilation on these trains is rubbish.

items.title: The worst train service ever
items.review_text: The worst train service ever, you can expect your desired train to be delayed on a daily basis, as well as the shocking condition of the seats on most of the trains.

items.title: Southern railway useless morons
items.review_text: Useless morons, constantly late, BS excuses, but rip customers off, moron staff who can't be bothered to answer questions let alone barely speak english.

items.title: South Shitstern

If I could give South Eastern a 0 I would. An all round appalling service, making hard working people late to work every morning due to cancelling trains and cramming people onto as many as they can. 

The statement “20 minutes to Central London” for the new flats at Kidbrooke is an absolute farce, it takes 40 if you’re lucky in the worst
conditions. Sort out your service it is a disgrace.

Recognition for great customer service even when not on shift.

Thank you.
Abbey

It’s bad enough the trains are often late but really health and safety must be a priority I shall inform my mp.
I’ve never had a response from Se rail absolutely shocking they should have their franchise taken.

items.review_text: Southern Eastern railway is the worse  railway company in Britain.
